Aside from farming, Pech always goes out to buy rice in bulk from other domestic farmers, and then she will sell it to gain income. Her two children assist her in this activity. 

Currently, she uses her motorcycle to transport the rice to stock up in her house, but now it is getting old and often needs to be repaired. In order to deal with this problem, Pech would like to seek a Kiva loan to buy a second motorcycle for replacing the broken one. She would also like to use half the loan funds to help support her husband’s business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her business and to help support her husband’s business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has been in the hog-raising business for 10 years. She has a small backyard piggery where she raises pigs. She also owns and manages a sari-sari store, which sells various items like shampoo and soap. Mary plans to use her loan to buy pig feeds and more items to sell such as canned goods and spices.

Mary is 33 years old and is a married woman with 4 children.  Her oldest child is 23 years old. Mary's husband works as a driver. Mary hopes for her children to succeed in life.

loans.use: buy feeds for her pigs and items to sell  in her store

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is one of the CCT* community's partners with a passion for technology. This shows in his business, which is a computer shop. At 32 and having graduated from college, Albert is doing well making his business grow. He currently lives with Judalyn and their son in Tanza, Cavite. 

Albert makes it a point that people who have the same passion as he should have easy access to the Internet. Thus, every day he opens his shop for online users in his community, whose ages range from elementary students to middle class working professionals. His shop is located adjacent to his house so that he can manage it more efficiently.  Albert has been successful for four years now even without the aid of any employees. Monthly, he earns an estimated net income of Php 9,200.

To help him improve his business and continuously feed his passion, Albert solicits the help of CCT by applying for a loan worth Php 11,000. He intends to use this loan to purchase another computer for his shop. With this fund, he can also be equipped with ready money to purchase any necessary spare parts for his existing set of computers. According to him, this loan will definitely increase his profits and lead to the creation of an additional branch. 

Certainly there are times when trouble occurs, not just with his computers but also with his health. These are the struggles he currently faces. Nevertheless, Albert fights these struggles head on, knowing that his faith in the Lord and his undying passion will carry him through. It is his desire to have a healthy life and a strong family relationship. He also aims to have his own house as he strives to support his son all the way to college.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: buy a computer

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is 27 years old.  She has 2 children who are 2 and 3 ½  years old.  Both of her children are still too young for school.   

Claudine owns a store in which she sells rice, cooking oil, different kinds of flour, and rice.  Claudine's husband runs the business with her.   Her husband takes these products and sells them at the market as Claudine runs the store. They have been running this business for 1 ½ years and it has enabled them to feed their family.  

Claudine is requesting a loan to buy more items for her shop in order to make more profits.  With the additional profits, she plans to feed her family and make some savings.

loans.use: buy items such as rice, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Maritess

texts.en:
Maritess is 32 years of age and married with two school-aged children. She is engaged in farming activities where she plants and harvests rice to sell.

Maritess is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. Maritess has operated this business for almost four years. With her income, she is able to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides

location.town: Brgy. San Fabian, Kayapa, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Riffat's Group

texts.en:
Riffat is 36 years old, married, and has two children – a son and a daughter. Both of the children are young and getting an education. Her husband operates a Punjabi food restaurant. He provides good quality and tasty food to his customers, which is why his restaurant runs very well and make him good profits every month.
Riffat is a housewife who stays at home, looks after her children, and performs her daily household tasks. She also supports her husband by preparing food for him. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, to improve her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy required ingredients such as lentils, cooking oil, rice, spices etc. that will help him prepare better quality food for his customers and increase his profits. He has been operating this business for the past 20 years and Riffat is hopeful that this investment will be a productive one for him.
Note: In the photo, the lady slightly raising her hand is Riffat.

loans.use: to buy the required ingredients for her husband's Punjabi restaurant.

loans.name: Kahtan

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, single and lives with four family members, of whom one of them works.
Kahtan has run a bakery since 2006, where he makes the Alsamun type of traditional Iraqi bread. This bread is made in traditional stone ovens that are fired with oil or gas. He has 25 years' experience in this field, gained since he was a child. He has a good reputation and is well known in his area.
Kahtan is requesting a $3,000 loan to pay the annual rent on his bakery. He is aiming to earn more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent on his bakery.

loans.name: Lhagvajargal

texts.en:
Lhagvajargal is a 49-year-old widow who lives with her daughter in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter, age 10, goes to a secondary school. 

Lhagvajargal manages a grocery business at a local market. She started her business in 2007 and is planning to continue it in the future. She must work hard in order to stabilize her business because it is only source of income for her family.  Lhagvajargal is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more grocery products in order to expand her business.

loans.use: buy more grocery products to sell

loans.name: Stephanie

texts.en:
Stephanie is 52 years old   She has 5 children who are between 15 and 31 years old.  Two of her children are in school while the rest have completed high school and haved stopped their studies. She is a widow and is very hardworking. 

Stephanie sells a variety of snacks including popcorn, sambusas (a snack made out of wheat flour and minced meat) and roasted peanuts. She has had this business for 19 years and it has enabled her to meet the needs of her family. 

Stephanie is requesting a loan to buy cooking oil, wheat flour and food items such as irish potatoes, maize, green bananas, etc.  to sell.  With the profits, she plans pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: Buy cooking oil, wheat and food items to resell

loans.name: Sapia

texts.en:
Unlike many of her fellow community partners in CCT*, Sapia is still single and has no family of her own to think about. Nonetheless, at 27, Sapia still aims to make her business a success as it is the primary means for her to achieve a sustainable living. She attended college and presently resides near the public market in Tanza, Cavite. 

Sapia’s business centers on selling retail items such as bags, toys, watches, and other accessories. She sells these among friends, business acquaintances and fellow community members, who do not see it too imprudent to purchase items which might not be considered essential. Sapia locates her business in the community's public market and for four years she has managed to go without any employees. Monthly, she earns an estimated net income of Php 11,680.

To help her sustain her business, Sapia decides to ask for help from CCT by applying for a loan for Php 30,000. She wants to use this loan to purchase stocks of school bags and socks, as well as other items such as wallets and watches. Sapia sees the loan as crucial in supporting her working capital and bringing about an increase in her profits. She intends to use the profits to sustain her business and her living.

There are many dreams in Sapia’s heart, that is why no matter how big the challenges are, they fail to distract her focus. She dreams of making her business grow and become sustainable, and she is grateful to those people who enable her to achieve it. As a CCT community partner, Sapia faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to increase her inventory

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo has been in the hog-raising business for 5 years. He has a backyard piggery where he raises pigs for fattening. Reynaldo sells his pigs at his town's local market. He also works as a palm oil harvester in his town. He plans to use his loan to purchase pig feeds, vitamins and other supplies.

Reynaldo works hard for his family, which includes his wife and 4 children. His oldest child is 20 years old. He hopes to succeed in sending his children to school and providing them with better living conditions.

loans.use: buy pig feeds, vitamins and other supplies

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 24 years old, married and has two children. Haydar has owned a medical laboratory since 2009. He specialized in this field so he has good experience, a good reputation, and is well known.
He is requesting a loan of $1,800 to pay the annual rent on his laboratory. He is aiming to earn more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent on his laboratory.

loans.name: Nyamdorj

texts.en:
Nyamdorj is 27 years old.  He lives with his wife and daughter in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the  Uvs province of Mongolia. He manages a shoemaking business in his town with the help of his wife. Nyamdorj started this business in 2009 and has gained much experience. Now he makes a variety of Mongolian traditional shoes that sell for 40,000-50,000 MNT per pair. His business is one of the most profitable businesses in his town. With his earnings, Nyamdorj bought a washing machine and a motorcycle for his family. He is a hardworking man who is planning to expand his occupation and open a construction business. 

Nyamdorj is requesting a 1,300,000 MNT loan to purchase more materials for his business.

loans.use: buy materials for his shoemaking business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman who lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Esther operates a clothes selling business.  She sells from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. Esther faces a major challenge in competition from other clothes sellers in the market. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the loan for Kshs 20,000, Esther she wants to purchase 2 bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy 2 bundles of clothes to resell

loans.name: Sarafeen's Group

texts.en:
Sarafeen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, to improve her animal sales business. She will use the loan to buy goats and sheep. She will raise them up with good food and then sell them to butchers for profit. Besides her business, Sarafeen also manages her household work efficiently. She has four sons and a daughter. All of them study, except the youngest who is only three years old. Her husband is a painter by profession and paints houses and buildings to order.
Sarafeen is very hopeful about the future growth of her animal sales business and about a better financial future for her family. She has been operating this business for the past 14 years. Note: In the photo, the lady with the book (an Asasah Passbook) is Sarafeen.

loans.use: to buy goats and sheep for her animal sales business.

loans.name: Burikhon

texts.ru: Бурихон житель города Куляб. Ему 54 года. Он женат. У него двое детей. Его жена занимается торговлей. Сам Бурихон предоставляет услугу такси. Он развозит людей с одного места на другое. Точнее он развозит людей с центра города до автовокзала и обратно. Этим видом деятельности занимается 6 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения новой машины марки Тико. Так как эта машина расходует мало топлива.
texts.en: Burikhon lives in the town of Kulob. He is 54 years old. He is married, with two children. His wife is in retail business. Burikhon provides taxi services. He transports passengers per request. He also transports passengers from the center of town to the intercity bus terminal and back. He has been in this business for six years. He takes a loan to buy a new Tico car, because this type of car has low  gas usage.

loans.use: to purchase a new Tico car

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 23 years old, married and has one child. Maher has worked in auto retailing and washing since 2003. He has 13 years of experience in this field, has a good reputation, and is well known in his area.
He is requesting a loan of $1,800 to renovate his garage and buy car wash equipment. He is aiming to earn more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to renovate his garage and buy car wash equipment.

loans.name: Heriknaz

texts.en: Heriknaz is from the village of Gtashen in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is married with two sons (twenty-three and twenty-five years old).  Heriknaz has a high school education and has been engaged in farming for the past twenty-five years.  In addition to supporting her family she helps relatives with produce grown on her farm.  Heriknaz is looking for a loan to purchase livestock.  She expects her family income to increase by twenty percent with the investment.  She dreams for her grandchildren to live happy, healthy lives and hopes to expand her business.  She enjoys the nature of her village and the farming life.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Robelyn

texts.en:
Robelyn is a married woman with 5 children. Her husband works as a farmer.

Robelyn has been in the hog-raising business for 3 years. She raises pigs in her backyard and sells them at the market. Robelyn also helps her husband grow rice on their farm.

This loan will be used to purchase feeds and farm inputs such as fertilizer. In the future, Robelyn hopes to have good living conditions.

loans.use: buy pig feeds and farm inputs

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is from the village of Makawa, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old, married, and has four adult children. To make a living, Editha runs a general store in the local community.  She has been engaged in this business for 20 years and earns approximately 5650 PHP a month from these activities. 

Editha joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from PMPC. 

Editha is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, with which she will purchase more products such as dry goods, canned goods, and home supplies for her general store business. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Editha from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: buy more inventory for her general store business

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann, 43, needs to give a lot of care and attention, since her focus rests not only on her children but also on her piglets—which make up her business. Mary Ann is a high school graduate and is married to Luis, a driver. Together they are raising four children, two of whom are still in school. Their family currently resides in Tanza, Cavite.

Owning a piggery requires a lot of effort and Mary Ann recognizes this. Every day she has to make sure the piglets are given the right nutrition, stay in a good environment, and has the right suitable conditioning. She considers all these factors to make sure the piglets produce well. She also continuously seeks ways to improve the piggery. Mary Ann has been managing this business for 11 years, and makes a net income of around Php11,350 each month.

To help her continue  the operations of her piggery, Mary Ann is requesting a loan for Php 27,000.  She will use this loan to purchase feeds for her piglets and materials to renovate her piggery. Included in the list of items to buy are hollow blocks, cement, and wood. She says that the profits will be used as additional investment in the future. 

One challenge Mary Ann faces is when the pigs get sick.  She is also concerned about her children, as lately they have become disobedient when it comes to attending school. But Mary Ann is maximizing every resource she has at hand to make sure she arrives at the results she wanted. She dreams of becoming prosperous and raising her piggery to the next level. Of course, it is also her dream to see her children finish their education and have a career of their own someday, because the bottom line is that she cares and loves her children most. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy hog feed & vitamins and materials to renovate her piggery

loans.name: Yanjmaa

texts.en: Yanjmaa is 36 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a house in Darhan city, Mongolia. Her daughter, 13, goes to a local secondary school. Yanjmaa runs a business selling clothes which she started in 1994, and gained much experience. Since then her business has been quite successful which allowed her to employ some workers and to improve her living conditions. Also with her earnings she managed to buy a plot of land where she built a house for her family and a car used in her business. She is hard-working lady who is doing her best to feed her family. In addition she plants trees and vegetables in her backyard. She says, "With my business savings I had a chance to improve my life. I want to expand my business in order to pay tuition fees for my daughter's education." Yanjmaa is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase materials in order to sew more clothes to sell during graduation ceremony of students.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her sewing business

loans.name: Por

texts.en:
Por is a chief villager who grows rice and some fruit trees on his farm. He currently lives in the Baray district. He is married and blessed with seven children. Four of his children are employed. 

Por’s wife is a recycling seller. She buys used goods to sell to a wholesaler, who then sells the goods in bulk to other countries. The used goods she deals in are mostly leftover electricity wires. 

The family typically generates a revenue of US $5 each day to cover the family expense. Por is requesting a loan of $800 from Kiva through HKL to be used to grow fruit.

loans.use: to grow fruit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a generator for his shop.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent is 25 years old and single. He has been running his butchery for about three years with an income of KES.13,000 a month. This is his second loan with KADET LTD, after successfully repaying the previous one. He wants to use the loan to buy a cow for slaughter and sale in his butchery. Vincent hopes to own a plot of land and develop a house and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy a cow for slaughter and sale in his butchery.

loans.name: Enhtur

texts.en: Enhtur is 29 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in his parents' backyard. They live in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His older son, age 5, goes to kindergarten and his younger son who hasn't reached school age stays home. He runs a food cafe with the help of his wife. He started his business in 2005 but, because of family problems, had to shut it down for two years and start a construction business to supplement his earnings. Now he wants to reopen his food cafe at a local market. He is a friendly and open-minded person who attributes his business success to good managerial skill. He says: "I want to have my own house with the savings." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase equipment for his new cafe.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for a cafe

loans.name: Batool

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 54 years old, divorced and has one child who works. She lives with four family members.
Batool has worked as a tailor since 2000. She makes and repairs women's clothing. She has long experience in this field, a good reputation, and is well known in her area. She is requesting a loan of $1,800 to buy a sewing machine, generator and refrigerator. She is aiming to earn more profits so she can improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, generator and refrigerator.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn is married and 23 years old. She has a retail shop where she sells different products in their community. Genalyn has operated this business for two years.

Genalyn is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase commodities such as soap and condiments. Each month, Genalyn earns about PHP 3,000 from this business.

In the future, Genalyn hopes that her general store will become a grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase more commodities to sell such as soap and condiments

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past two years, she has operated a second- hand clothes selling business at the market and door-to-door. Susan faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation when selling door-to-door. She dreams of expanding and becoming a wholesale distributor in the future. With the Kshs 20,000 Susan wants to purchase bales of second-hand clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bales of second-hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa, 47, makes every effort to see to it that her business is under her control. Not able to finish college, she is married to Marcial who works as a security guard. Together they raise two children who attend school in Tanza, Cavite.

Elsa's main activity is buying goods based on quality and affordability. She sells these items to business connections and gains a considerable amount of profit. The business has no official commercial space of its own — at least yet. She has been running this business for four years without the help of employees. Every month she earns a net income of Php6, 820.

To help her continue operating her business, she is applying for a loan of Php9, 000 to purchase more stock for her business, such as shoes and apparel. She also plans to start selling electronic loads for mobile phones across various network service providers. The profits from this business will be used in the future to invest in a house for rent.

One challenge for Elsa is inventory control. She finds it hard to make an accurate couint of her goods; she also lacks time for her family, which is very crucial. But she realizes that proper management of what she has — time and resources — is the solution to the problem. Elsa desires to see her kids finish their education and have a stable business of their own. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more shoes, clothing and cosmetics ordered in advance by her customers.

loans.name: Hélène

texts.fr:
Femme âgée de 54 ans, mariée, mère de 2 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 36 et 38 ans.
Depuis 18ans, elle est dans la petite pâtisserie : Beignets. Ses ventes journalières sont comprises entre 8000F et 15000F.
Sa clientèle est composée entre autre des passants et les élèves car elle exerce non loin d’une école. 
Ce prêt va lui permettre  d’augmenter ses provisions tel que : 1sac de farine, 1bidon d’huile, 1sac de sucre, 1 paquet de levure boulangère, 1 sachet de sel fin, des fagots de bois, des lots de sachets d’emballage.
Construire sa maison, y habiter avec ses petits fils est son soucis mangeur, pour cela elle veut continuer avec Hope Congo pour épargner d’avantage et augmenter ses revenus. Respectueuse et entreprenante elle la maman de tout ceux qui l’approche.
texts.en: This is a woman who is 54 years old, married, and the mother of two children, aged 36 and 38 years old. She has been involved for eighteen years in bakery goods: beignets. Her daily sales range from 8,000 to 15,000 francs. Her customer base is composed of passers-by and students because she operates near a school. This loan will enable her to increase her provisions, such as: a sack of flour, a container of oil, a sack of sugar, a packet of leavening, a bag of fine salt, bundles of firewood, and plenty of bags for wrapping her products. Her main concern is to build a house in which to live with her grandchildren. To do so, she wants to continue with HOPE Congo to save more money and to increase her revenues. A respectful and enterprising woman, she is like a mom to all those who come to her.

loans.use: To buy flour, a container of oil, a sack of sugar, leavening, a bundle of firewood, and bags for wrapping items.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en: Narine lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Hovouny.  She is a self-taught accountant with sixteen years of farming experience. Narine is happily married with two sons (eighteen and nineteen years old).  Her dream is for her sons to graduate from university.  Narine would like a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and fuel.  She expects the family income to increase by ten percent with the investment.  She will use the proceeds to pay education costs and grow her business.  She is satisfied with the services of microfinance.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and fuel

loans.name: Sohaila

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 43 years old, widowed and has three children, all of whom work. She lives with two family members.
Sohaila has worked as a tailor since 2000. She makes and repairs women's, men's and children’s clothing. She has good experience, a good reputation, and is well known in her area. She is requesting a loan of $1,800 to buy a generator and a sewing machine. She is aiming to earn more profits so she can improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a generator and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Mishigdorj

texts.en:
Mishigdorj is 52 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in a house in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her eldest son is a student while the younger one hasn't reached school age so stays at home.
Mishigdorj manages a beauty salon where she provides massage services for her customers. She started her business after graduating from college as a masseuse. Since then her business has been quite successful, which allowed her to build a strong customer base. She is a hardworking lady who is doing her work to feed her family. She says, "All I want is to educate my children and help them to be better people." She is requesting a 3,200,000 MNT loan to purchase materials to design her workplace.

loans.use: to purchase materials to design her workplace.

loans.name: Muharam

texts.ru: Мухарам проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 48 лет. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Двое ее сыновей находятся на заработках за рубежом. Сама она занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет участок земли, где выращивает овощи и сеет злаковые культуры. В этой области она 10 лет. Целью получения кредита является закуп семян и минеральных удобрений для посева.
texts.en: Muharam lives in Yavan. She is 48 years old, married, and has five children. Two of her sons are working abroad. She farms. At her house she has a plot of land where she grows vegetables and grains. She has been doing this for ten years.  She is taking out a loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for her crops.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Kaetua

texts.en: Kaetua is 33 years old, married and has two children. He has been farming his piece of land for the past five years. He has been a good client and this will be his third loan from Kiva partner, KADET. He plans to use the loan to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer. He hopes to make a profit and use it to educate his children and expand his farming business. Kaetua dreams of prospering in farming to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, to improve her son’s vegetable sales business. He operates his business from his home and provides fresh seasonal vegetables to his customers. With the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal vegetables in bulk, which will enable him to meet the urgent needs of his customers and increase his sales.
Zarina’s husband operates a donkey cart and provides loading facilities to his customers. He is still very active at the age of 55 and provides quality services to his clients by dropping their goods at designated places. Zarina is the mother of four children. Her second son has a furniture sales business while her third son is an electrician by profession. Her daughter is eight years old and stays at home. Zarina wanted to educate her children but she was not able to do so due to financial constraints.
Her eldest son started his business six months ago. Zarina is confident that a loan investment will help him increase his profits and improve the financial condition of his business.

loans.use: to buy fresh seasonal vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Saad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 24 years old, single and lives with four family members, of whom one works.
Saad has run an advertising agency since 2005. He gained experience from his father and now has a good reputation and is well known in his area. He is requesting a loan of $2,400 to pay the annual rental on his workplace. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to pay the annual rental on his workplace.

loans.name: Sainsanaa

texts.en: Sainsanaa is 38 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in someone else's backyard. They live in Uvs province, Mongolia. His daughter, who is three years old, goes to a kindergarten. Sainsanaa manages a transportation service business in his town. He started his business in 2004 with a rented truck. He is planning to have his own truck in the future. He says, "I want to have my own truck and a house for my family." He is requesting a 400,000 MNT loan to purchase vegetable seeds to start a vegetable planting business in addition to his transportation business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Feliza

texts.en:
Feliza, 44, is one of the community partners in CCT* with a heart to help others. Even as she makes her microbusiness grow, it is in her heart to extend the blessings to others. Feliza graduated from high school and now heads a family with Carlito, a mechanic. Feliza and Carlito raise eight children: one is in college, three are in high school, two study in elementary school and the other two stay home.
A vulcanizing shop is Feliza's business. She manages this hand in hand with Carlito, with no need yet for hiring employees. Everyday, they cater to clients in the vicinity with vehicles that need repairing. Feliza has been in this business for ten years and earns 10,600 PHP per month. She believes that her shop is going well but that it can be improved a lot more.
To capitalize on this opportunity to improve and level up, Feliza is seeking financial help by means of a 10,000 PHP loan. She intends to use this primarily to buy a machine needed for her vulcanizing shop. This added facility will definitely improve performance and, consequently, profits. The loan is a beacon of hope for her towards a growth in profits, and it serves as an encouragement to her to save more with the help of CCT. Feliza says that with the loan, she is more enabled to help others.
Feliza struggles with sickness at present, which hinders her from performing at her best and maximizing the opportunity to help others. Still, she believes in the Lord to strengthen her and bless her business as she remains faithful to her work with discipline and integrity. Feliza desires to lead a successful and peaceful life. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy a new machine for her vulcanizing shop.

loans.name: Saad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and has three children. Saad has run a shop selling toys, phones and CDs since 2008. He has three years experience in this field, a good reputation, and he is being  well known in his area.
He is requesting a $1,500 loan to purchase additional machines for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase additional machines for his shop.

loans.name: Leo Steven

texts.en: Leo Steven is 30 years old. He has two children who are ages 2 and 6 years. They are both in school. His wife is a teacher. Leo Steven owns a bar in which he sells different kinds  of beer, water and MTN communication company cards. He has done this business for six years and it has enabled him to pay school fees for his children and improve his standards of living. He is requesting a loan to buy different kinds of beer.

loans.use: to purchase beer for sale.

loans.name: Adida

texts.en:
Adida is a married man with seven children, three of whom are in school while four graduated from school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is the purchase of seeds for farming.

For the past five years, he has operated a mangrove-selling business, selling at the market to his neighbors and passersby. He also does farming as his other source of income. Adida faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of becoming the leading mangrove dealer in the future. 

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase bundles of mangrove for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of mangrove for sale.

loans.name: Parmeis

texts.en:
Parmeis is 31 years old, married and supports four people. 

He has been a farmer for the past four years with a monthly income of 5,000 Kenyan shillings. He paid the previous loan well, and he has applied for his second loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers. With the profits generated, he plans to expand his farming and venture into the livestock-keeping business.

He dreams to be rich. He is an assiduous man who works with effort to attain more despite limited resources.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is now 39 years of age and married with four school-aged children. Saturnina is a farmer working in the Philippines who earns PHP 5,000 per month. 

Saturnina is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her corn farm. Saturnina has been growing corn for 15 years.

In the future, Saturnina hopes to have a large crop of corn in order to gain income to satisfy the daily basic needs of her family, most especially the educational needs of her children. She also believes that she can improve their status of living and start another kind of business through the continuous support and assistance of the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her corn farm

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
This is Remedios, who is 56. She is a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is a widow with children who have already established their own families. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Remedios operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo,  5-Philippines-pesos (Php) worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Remedios earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. She also incorporates into her store a mineral-water refilling area while managing their rag-making business. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 40,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She will also purchase additional raw materials needed for her rag-making business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her businesses. 

Remedios hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to have her own house renovated before the end of the year. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for cases of beverages and mineral water for her variety store and for additional raw materials needed for her rag-making business.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en: Lilibeth is from Mayors Village, Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she is presently engaged in buying and selling fashion accessories and cosmetics. She has been engaged in this business for five years and earns approximately 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. She is now requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more fashion accessories and cosmetics to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Lilibeth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living standards of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion accessories and cosmetics to sell.

location.town: Mayor Village Lapasan, Clarin Mis Occ

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married and has four children. He lives with 18 family members, of whom seven work.
Since 2005, Kassem has had a shop selling electrical installation equipment for the home. He has long experience in this field, a good reputation and is well known in his area. He is requesting a $2,000 loan to pay the annual rent on his shop and to increase his stock. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent on his shop and increase his stock.

loans.name: Kuume

texts.en:
Kuume is 33 years old, married and blessed with one child. He is a farmer and has been in this business for the last five years. His farm is in a productive area, which has proved to be good for maize farming. He learned about Kiva partner, KADET, through a marketing campaign carried out by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his third loan, with which he is planning to buy maize seed and fertilizers.
Kuume hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his maize production and educate his child. His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land. He is a particular man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy maize seed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rakhila

texts.ru: Rakhila 45 let. Ona zamujem i imeyet 2 detey kotoriye uchatsya v shkole. Rakhila Yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselelnec iz Agdam , seychas projivyet v Absheron regione  vmeste so svoyey drujelubnoy semyoy. Rakhila uje 7 let kak imeyet magazin dlya prodaji pishevix produktov. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi uvelichit pomesheniye dlya togo chtobi razmestiti bolshe tovarov dlya razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en: Rakhila is 45 years old.  She is married and has two children who go to school.  Rakhila is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  She is a refugee from Agdam who now lives in the Absheron region with her loving family. Rakhila has owned a grocery shop for seven years. Now she needs 2300 AZN to expand her shop so it will hold more goods and she can expand her business.

loans.use: to expand her shop

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: Ester is from the village of Pokr Sepasar in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She was born in Pokr Sepasar and lives near her relatives.  The main economic activity in Ester’s village is farming.  She has been engaged as a private entrepreneur in farming for over twenty years.  Ester is married with four children – a twenty-one-year-old daughter and three sons (twenty-five, twenty-six, and twenty-eight years old).  She hopes to grow her business and save money to repair and improve the cattle shed.  Ester is looking for a loan to purchase seeds and fuel.  With this investment she expects the family income to increase by ten percent.  She is pleased with the services of microfinance.

loans.use: purchase seeds and fuel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary sells fish, cooking oil and sugar. She is 40 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom goes to school. Mary has taken a loan to stock more fish, cooking oil and sugar for resale. She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits.

loans.use: to stock more fish, cooking oil and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Remedio

texts.en:
No matter what ups or downs might happen, life continues to flow. And Remedio, 50, learns to go with the flow while making sure he stays afloat. Remedio only reached high school. At present, he is a community partner in CCT* who actively attends Bible fellowships, trains on how to run a microenterprise, and saves for future business use. He is married to Jessielyn, and together they raise three children. They currently live in Tanza, Cavite.
Remedio has a rolling store – a store on wheels. He sells items that are of good use to customers on a daily basis, such as plastic wares and small appliances. For five years, Remedio has gotten to know what his fellow community members typically look for. With this business, he makes a net income of around 10,000 PHP per month. He manages to keep his business going without any employees at his side.
To help him continue to operate his business, he is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP. He views this loan as a big boost to his capital, with which he is able to purchase necessary items to expand his product inventory. It is crucial for him to acquire whatever item his customers are looking for, and this loan enables him to do just that.
Life keeps on flowing, and while there is a positive look to it, it also brings challenges to Remedio. One of the uncertainties Remedio feels as he goes along with the flow every day is that he is not certain how they will survive each day, as there is still no concrete means of sustaining his business. One thing he holds to, however, is the business that he has. That is why he makes sure he meets every need of his customers so they will patronize his business and buy regularly from him. Even as he desires sustainability for his business, he prays for a good business space with a low rental rate. He longs deeply to see his children finish school and learn not just to go along with the flow but to make things happen. As a CCT community partner, he faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy assorted household items and accessories to restock his rolling store.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en:
Arturo is 56 years old and married with two adult-aged children. Arturo owns a motorcycle that he uses as a source of income. He is in the motorcycle transport business. With the business, he generates PHP 4,000 a month.

Arturo is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy materials for the maintenance of the motorcycle such as tires.

In the future, Arturo hopes that his transportation business will improve further to sustain the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy tires for his motorcycle

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 32 years old. He is married and blessed with two children. Simon is a farmer and has been in this business for the last three years. His farm is in a productive area, which has proved to be good for maize farming.
Simon learned about Kiva partner, KADET, through a marketing campaign carried out by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his third loan, with which he is planning to buy maize seed and fertilizers. He hopes to use the profits from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his maize production and educate his children to higher levels of education. His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer, buy a bigger piece of land and build a permanent home. He is a picky man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy maize seed and fertilizers

loans.name: Vianney

texts.en: Vianney is 26 years old. He is not married. He owns a supermarket in which he sells several items such as water, sugar, juices, biscuits, milk etc. He has done this business for one year and eight months and it has enabled him to meet his needs. He is requesting a loan to buy more items for his supermarket and make more profits. He plans to save all his profits.

loans.use: To buy items for his supermarket.

loans.name: Gombo

texts.en: Gombo is 57 years old and lives with his wife in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Uvs province, Mongolia. His older daughter is unemployed and his younger son is a student. He manages a meat and dairy products trading business with the help his wife. His wife is responsible for selling dairy products and Gombo, himself, is responsible selling meat and meat products. He started his business in 1995 and is planning to continue it in the future. Their business was quite successful, which allowed them to buy a ger for their children and have 100 more husbandry animals for their business. He is a polite and kind man who says, "I am planning to have horses in the future." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase 40 sheep for his business.

loans.use: To purchase 40 sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a freezer

loans.name: Saddam

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married and has three children.

Saddam has a factory where he has sold cement and gravel since 2004. He has seven years of experience in this field. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $3m000 loan to make an iron ceiling for his shop and to increase his products. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To make an iron ceiling for his shop and to increase his products

loans.name: Semalyn

texts.en:
Semalyn is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 54 years old. Semalyn is married and has six adult-aged children. 

To make a living, Semalyn makes and sells food, running a snack-vending business in the local community. Semalyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Semalyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Semalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. 

Semalyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business This will be the second loan taken out by Semalyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty sells alcohol. She is 28 years old and married, with two children. One of them goes to school.

Betty borrowed a loan to stock more alcohol to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future with extra profits.

loans.use: to stock more alcohol to sell.

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en: Andranik is from the village of Haritch in the Shirak region of Armenia.  He is the proud father of three children – a nine-year-old daughter and two sons (seventeen and nineteen).  For eighteen years, Andranik and his wife have been working on the family farm.  He dreams for all his children to receive a university education.  Andranik would like a loan to purchase potato seeds and livestock.  He expects the family income to increase by twelve percent with the investment.  In Haritch, Andranik is surrounded by relatives and good friends.  He is pleased that he is able to make loan payments in his village.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: This borrower is from Iraq. He is 24 years old, married and has two children. Ali has run a cafeteria and a playing hall since 2009. He has a good reputation and is well known in his area. He is requesting a $2,000 loan to renovate his shop and buy a refrigerator. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Reut

texts.en:
Reut is a 24-year-old single man, supporting his parents. His monthly income is KES 1,000.

He has been a farmer for the past five years. Maize farming is doing well is his area due to favorable conditions.

He learned about KADET Ltd. through advertisement done by KADET. He has been a good client. He repaid the previous loan well. 

He has applied for a third loan of KES 30,000 from KADET, with which he plans to buy wheat seeds and fertilizers. He plans to use the proceeds from the loan to plow back into the farm. He has never taken a loan from another microfinance institution.

He is a genuine man who will struggle to achieve if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy wheat seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Medina

texts.en:
This is Medina, 52, a resident of Tala, Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Servillo and is the mother of five children. Two of them are already working, while the other three are still in school. 

At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her remaining children all the way through college. This is a dream for most Filipino parents like Medina, as she herself is a high school graduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Medina operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets, and other home trappings, but she also fulfills seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and she does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities of fabrics, threads, beads, accessories, zippers, buttons, needles and newspapers for patterns. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Medina dreams to be able to give her all her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work in her business. She prays to have a brand new sewing machine. 

She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of god she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for materials needed for her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Zoulfokar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 24 years old, single and lives with three family members, of whom one works.
Zoulfokar is a blacksmith; he has had a turner workshop and has sold welding supplies since 2009. He has good experience, a good reputation, and is well known in his area. He is requesting $1,800 loan to renovate his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to renovate his workshop.

loans.name: Otgonzaya

texts.en:
Otgonzaya is 33 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband is a driver who manages a taxi service in their town. Her older daughter goes to a local secondary school. 

Otgonzaya manages a beauty product trading business at a rented stall at a trading center called Minj. Since she started her business, it has developed and flourished. With her earning she pays the tuition fee of her children and buys all the necessities of their family. 

She is a kind woman who is planning to expand her business in the future. She says, "I want to have one more stall in order to increase my sales channels." 

She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more products and to rent one more stall.

loans.use: To purchase more products and expand her business.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Née en 1978, Akouvi est née à Lomé et mère au foyer avec 02 enfants en charge. Coiffeuse de profession elle a ouvert son salon de coiffure depuis 2000 et emploie deux autres coiffeuses pour mieux satisfaire ses clientes. Parallèlement  elle vend des produits esthétiques dans son salon  pour répondre aux attentes de certaines clientes et leur faciliter la vie. Elle s’approvisionne sur place et affectionne son métier.
texts.en: Born in 1978 in Lomé, Akouvi is married  with two children in her care. A hairdresser by trade, she opened her salon in 2000 and employs two other hairdresser in order to better meet her clients’ needs. In addition, she also sells beauty product to meet the expectations of some clients and make things convenient for them. She stocks up locally. She is enthusiastic about her profession.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Qajik

texts.en: Qajik lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Ghazanchi.  Ghazanchi has a favorable climate for raising livestock.  There are many meadows surrounded by alpine trees.  Qajik has been raising livestock for fifteen years and would like to expand his business.  Married with two daughters (twenty and twenty-one years old), Qajik wants to be able to continue supporting his daughters' education and future families.  By taking a microfinance loan and purchasing additional livestock, he expects to increase the family income by twenty-five percent.  In addition to investing in his family, some of the proceeds will be used to grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: 08.02.39 Thiệu Toán - Thiệu Hóa Group

texts.en:
Ngan is 19 years old.  She is married and does not have children.  She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.  

Ngan is the group leader of the 08.02.39 Thieu Toan solidarity group, which consists of 5 members.  She works in the agricultural sector, raising poultry and cattle.  Ngan has been involved in her business for less than a year.  The main hardship that she faces is a lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.  This will be Ngan's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.  The profit she generates will be reinvested into her business and used to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase baby chickens and pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 48 years old, married and has two children. She lives with ten family members, who four of them work.
Since 2000, Nidal has had a shop where she sells women’s clothing, accessories and cosmetics. She has long experience in this field, a good reputation and is well known in her area. She is requesting a $2900 loan to renovate and to have a larger store. She is aiming to gain more profits so she can improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To renovate and  to have a larger store.

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is a married woman who has children, all of whom attend school.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.  She owns a house that lacks electricity and water.  

For the past 20 years, Binti has owned and operated a kindergarten for children from the neighboring community.  She also sells khangas, which provides her with an additional source of income.  Binti dreams of expanding her school and having it become the best area school in the future. 

Binti joined Yehu to access funds that will help her boost her business.  The Kshs 50,000 loan will allow her to purchase chairs for the school and khangas and coconuts to sell.

loans.use: to purchase chairs for her school and khangas and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is 22 years old and single.  He is a farmer from the town of Nyamira in western Kenya.  He has been farming for four years.  His mixed farm produces coffee, maize, and beans, which are all sold locally.  He earns additional income from selling shoes to the local market.

Evans has requested a loan of 45,000 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  The supplementary income he will generate from the sale of milk will be saved for his future projects.  His primary business challenges are the shortage of fertilizer and lack of access to capital for expansion.  In the future, he plans to buy an acre of land and expand his coffee plantation.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Imanuel

texts.en:
Imanuel, 30, is a single man who lives with his parents and two siblings, who still attend school.  

He owns a tire repair business.  He also repairs couches on request, as he used to work in a furniture factory in Java.  Imanuel has been engaged in the tire repair business for a year.  He is grateful that his business is running smoothly.  He is able to serve 3-5 customers per day.  One day, Imanuel hopes to expand his business to include lubricant and new tire sales.  He currently does not have enough capital to finance an expansion. 

Fortunately, he met a TLM field officer who introduced him to TLM's individual lending program.  After learning about the lending program Imanuel submitted a loan application and request for a IDR 3,000,000 loan.  He will use the loan to purchase lubricant, new tires, and used tires.  Imanuel is confident that his expanded business will generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase lubricant, new tires, and used tires.

loans.name: 38Thiệu Long - Thiệu Hóa Group

texts.en:
Gam is 35 years old. She is married and has two children. Gam is the group leader of the 7.3.38 Thieu Long Solidarity Group, which consists of six members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

In 2003, Gam joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Gam has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Gam works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. Gam has been involved in this business for eight years. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business by purchasing baby chickens and pigs to raise.

The main hardship that Gam faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Gam hopes to maintain  a successful business, to remodel her house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: To purchase baby chickens and pigs to raise.

loans.name: Tseepil

texts.en:
Tseepil is 25 years old and lives with her older sister in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in the Sansar area of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

She manages a wool product making and trading business in Ulaanbaatar city. She makes variety of wool clothes such as shirts, pants, socks and gloves for all ages. Also she rents a stall and operates trading of clothes.

Previously, she used to work at a private company that manufactures wool products. There she gained much experience and knowledge needed in starting her own business. Since 2009 she start to sale clothes, which are imports from China.  

Now she rents a stall at a trading center in order to sell her products and clothes from China. 

She is a polite woman who says, "I am planning to broaden the collection of my clothes." 

She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes from China to sell at her stall.

loans.use: To purchase clothes from China to resell.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 19 years old, single and lives with five family members, of whom three work.
Since 2003, Ahmad has had a coffee shop where he prepares tea, coffee, soft drinks and Arguileh. He has a good reputation and is well known in his area. He is requesting a $2,600 loan to change his coffee shop’s furniture. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to change his coffee shop’s furniture.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is 26 years old, married and has one child. She has been in business for over three years.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd. She plans to buy more stock and fertilizer.  She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to invest in farming.

She is a very hardworking woman who runs a hotel in Narok town. She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock and fertilizer

loans.name: Mkhitar

texts.en: Mkhitar is from the village of Haritch in the Shirak region of Armenia.  He has a high school education and twelve years of experience as a private farmer.  Mkhitar is married with two sons (two and four years old).  Both Mkhitar and his wife want to save money for their children’s future education.  He would like a loan to purchase livestock and potato seeds.  With this investment, Mkhitar expects the family income to increase by fifteen percent.  In addition to supporting his family, Mkhitar also helps relatives with produce grown on the family farm.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and potato seeds

loans.name: Chimedtseren

texts.en:
Chimedtseren is 50 years old and lives with his wife and three daughters, who are 10 to 21 years old. The family lives in Mongolia's capital, Ulaanbaatar, in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent. His youngest daughter attends public school while his middle daughter is a student. Chimedtseren’s wife and oldest daughter work at a local restaurant.

Chimedtseren helps support his family by operating a folding door business. He makes folding doors to sell to retailers. 

When he first began his business in 2005, he didn’t have his own equipment and working capital, but he has since expanded and now he has equipment and a truck, which carries his handmade products, and 800,000 MNT in working capital. He recently purchased his truck with his business earnings so his working capital decreased. 

Chimedtseren is applying for a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to increase his working capital to make more folding doors. He says, “I want to improve my business with this loan and to be able to build our own small house, so my daughters and wife can enjoy better living conditions.” 

Chimedtseren is hardworking and responsible. Thus, his main goal is to give high education to his daughters.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making folding doors.

loans.name: 82 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Trúc is 57 years old. She is married and has six children. Trúc is the group leader of the 18.8.82 Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of six members. Trúc lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province. This is Trúc's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Trúc operates a food stall/restaurant selling meat. Trúc has been involved in this business for five years.

The main hardship that Trúc faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business by purchasing pork to make pork pie. 

With her business profit, Trúc  hopes for her children to find a good job, to maintain a successful business, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: To purchase pork to make pork pie.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes sells alcohol. She is 33 years old, married, and has 6 children. Five of her children go to school. Agnes hopes to expand her business in the future with extra profits.

loans.use: to stock more alcohol to sell.

loans.name: Shakhir

texts.ru:
Shakir jenat i imeyet 3 detey. On jivet v Baku regione, vmeste so svoyey jenoy i detmi. Shakir rodilsya v 1963 qodu. Uje 8 let kak on zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. 
Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit ovec dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva molochnoqo produkta. Shakir prodayet v magazini moloko, sir, yogurt  kotoriy delayet on i yeqo jena.
texts.en: Shakir is married and has three children.  He lives in Baku with his wife and children. Shakir was born in 1963.  He has been working as a herdsman breeding cattle for eight years. Now he needs 2300 AZN to buy sheep to increase the quality of dairy products he produces. Shakir sells milk, cheese, and yogurt (which he and his wife make) in stores.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is a 46-year-old widow with two sons. After her husband’s death, all three of them started to work in order to sustain the family financially. The eldest son makes furniture while the youngest son is a rickshaw driver and provides transport services to his passengers. Razia operates a clothes sales business. She sells clothes to customers in her community and earns a good amount of income every month. Along with her business, she also performs her household duties very well.
Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the expansion of her clothes sales business. With the loan, she will purchase clothes of different varieties in bulk in order to provide a better clothing choice to her customers. She hopes that the loan will prove to be a profitable investment for her business. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In her previous loan year, she established good credit behavior and never missed a meeting. Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Razia.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a 40-year- old hardworking mother, married to a building contactor. They have four young children.

Mona decided to use her skill to open her own home embroidery business. She started making embroidered traditional dresses, in addition to selling clothes. Doing that for six years has given her the credibility to work with wholesale traders. Now Mona want to buy more material so she can one day open her own clothes store in the area.

loans.use: To buy more fabric and fibers for her embroidery business

loans.name: 83 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thiệp has a manufacturing business sewing clothes. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business. Thiệp is 56 years old and she is married. She has 4 children.

Thiệp is the group leader of the 18.5.83 Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. She lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Thiệp has been involved in this business for 3 years.

The main harship that Thiệp faces in her business is the lack of capital. In the future, Thiệp hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to buy cloth to make clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a gas generator.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose sells onions, beans and rice. She is 30 years old, married and has 2 children. One of her children goes to school.

Rose borrowed a loan to stock more onions, beans and rice to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future with her extra profits.

loans.use: to stock more onions, beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 39 years old, married to Eunice and they have two school going children.
  
He has been planting potatoes to sell in Olkalou town for the last three years. He was introduced to KADET LTD, by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan. He paid his previous loan of KES 18,500 well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Samuel hopes to buy a pick-up truck to help him transport his produce to the local market.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Salah

texts.en:
Salah is 44 years and single. For the past six years, he has owned a beauty salon. Salah loves his work a lot and believes that women's beauty is worth taking care of. He has worked hard to improve himself and his business and has turned his shop from a hairdressing shop into a beauty salon. Salah intends to expand his business and add a variety of new services to cover most of his clients’ needs.
 
Salah is well-known in his region as a man with good reputation. He works hard to keep and improve this image. Salah has finally found the love of his life and that is why he is working so hard to improve his business and provide for his future family’s needs. He is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy new and improved beauty creams and to pay for his engagement expenses.

In the future, Salah hopes to expand his business and open a fitness center.

loans.use: to buy beauty creams for his salon and to pay for his engagement expenses

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
This is Zenaida, 52, resident of Gamban Riverside, Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Ramon, a butcher, and is mother of a child who is currently studying now. At this time, she is working hard to send her child up to college. College is a dream for most poor Filipino parents like Zenaida, as she herself has been an elementary graduate. She believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Zenaida operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and meats cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP200 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP40, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Zenaida dreams to be able to give her child a good and high quality education, through all her hard work on her business. She also prays for good health always and to be able to establish more food stalls someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for meat, vegetables and other raw ingredients needed for her food stall.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce sells Fish. She is 40 years old, married, and has 5 children. Only one of her children goes to school.

Joyce borrowed a loan to stock more fish to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits.

loans.use: to stock more fish to sell.

loans.name: Norly

texts.en:
For Norly, 54, being successful translates into being full. This is true for her both in her business, family life, and Christian ministry. Norly gives her fullest to achieve success in her business, even as she actively participates in the weekly Bible fellowships and entrepreneurial activities in CCT*. Norly remains single. She resides in Pasay City with the family she has grown up with.

Norly manages a “sari-sari” store into which she pours out her focus. She has this little space adjacent to their home where she displays her products, ranging from eggs to detergents to soft drinks—anything her valued customers would need. She sells a lot in her community, being able to come up with PHP18,000 net income per month. Norly has managed to run the business alone for ten years now.

In order to give more and more of her potential towards improving her store, Norly has to outsource more finances to back up her funds. She then decided to loan PHP12, 000 with the help of CCT. With these new funds, she intends to purchase more goods for her store. This will include cases of soft drinks, boxes of canned goods, and sachets of detergents and fabric conditioners. It is important for Norly that her shelves are full of products, as these will attract more customers to her store and still retain the regular ones. Because of the loan, she is able to sustain her business and make sure that she does not run out of products to sell. The loan enables her to buy the things she needs to sustain her lifestyle.

One challenge Norly faces, which is common to running sari-sari stores, is following up the debts of regular customers. Also, it is a struggle for her whenever she gets sick and weak, to run the store. But it is her goal to turn the store into a grocery. It is going to take her full effort to make it happen. 

Norly also desires to give her full commitment to the Christian ministry, where she belongs, and it has become of great help to her family. Included in her goals list are an owned house and a transportation vehicle for her business.
