*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: 40.thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ha works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Ha is 51 years old. She is married and has 3 children. Ha is the group leader of the 8.4.40.Thieu Toan solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. 
She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

In 2011, Ha joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Ha has been involved in this business for less than a year. The main hardship that Ha faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Ha hopes to maintain  a successful business, to remodel her house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 43 years old, married to Lucy and they have four children.  

James has practised farming in Olkalou town for the last six years. He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his fourth loan. He has paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, James plans to practice large scale farming and to become a leading farmer in Olkalou town.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Afua Enyonam Ehia

texts.fr: Revendeuse dans la mercerie et de mèches, Afua est âgée de 44 ans et vit en couple avec  son mari et ses 02 enfants. Elle a commencée son activité depuis 2008 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Elle est à son troisième cycle de prêt et mène son activité à bien. C’est une dame battante et  de bonne moralité.
texts.en: Afua, who is a retailer of haberdashery products and hair extensions, is 44 years old and lives with her husband and her two children. She began her business in 2008 and gets her supplies at the large market in Lomé. She is on her third loan and manages her business well. She is a fighter and a woman with high morals.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and haberdashery products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
K. is 35 years old and has six children. Her eldest son is a factory worker while the others are enrolled in school and getting an education. Her husband is a tailor by profession. He is an expert in his work and has a good number of customers in his area who give him regular orders. K.’s two brother-in-laws also live with her family. One of her brother-in-laws is also a tailor. The second is a daily wage laborer.
K. is very supportive – she knows that her husband alone is unable to meet the financial needs of the family. That’s why she operates a milk sales business. She keeps a buffalo at her home for this purpose. She milks it every day and sells the milk to her customers in her community for a profit. She also carries out her responsibilities as a housewife very well.
K. has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the expansion of her brother-in-law’s tailoring business. With the loan, he will buy a new sewing machine, which will help him fulfill orders on time and increase his profits. She is expecting that after the loan investment, her brother-in-law’s business will be improved and her family’s income will be increased, which will help them achieve a better standard of living. K. is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In her previous loan year, she established good credit behavior and never missed a meeting. Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is K..

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her brother-in-law's tailoring business.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is a 56 year old single lady. She has two children who are 27 and 24 years old. She has a video show business which she has been running as a primary business. She has been running it for a period of three years with an income of 8,000 Kenyan shillings per month.

She is taking the fourth loan with KADET, after repaying the previous one successfully. She will use the loan amount to start a cosmetic shop as a secondary business and later on, to expand the business. Her hope is to succeed in her business and to improve the living standards of her children.

loans.use: to start a cosmetic shop, as a secondary business.

loans.name: Frida

texts.en: Frida is from the village of Isahakyan in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is married with three children – two daughters (twenty-three and twenty-four years old) and a nineteen-year-old son.  Frida has a high school education and has been farming for the past ten years.  Through a microfinance loan, Frida would like to invest in her business with the goal of increasing both revenues and net profit.  By purchasing fertilizer and feed, she expects the family income to increase by twenty percent.  She likes living in Isahakyan and considers the villagers good people.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and feed

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther has practiced potato farming in Olkalou town for the last 9 years. She sells all her produce in the local market, at retail prices. She is 53 years old and a single mother of 5 school-aged children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her third loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds, fertilizer and pay her casual workers.

In the future, Esther is planning to practice mixed farming and has become a leading supplier of milk in Olkalou town.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and to pay casual workers.

texts.en:
Salim is a married man with one child who attends school. He owns a house that has electricity, but no piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees.

For the past 2 years, he has operated a vegetable selling business. He sells in a shop to his neighbours and passersby. Salim faces a major challenge of seasonality in the business. During the rainy season, the demand for green vegetables is lower compared to dry hot season where the demand is higher. He dreams of expanding the business and establishing another shop in the future.

With the KES 10,000 he wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages, sukumawiki (green vegetables), onions, garlic and pepper. Salim decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages, sukumawiki (green vegetables), onions, garlic and pepper.

loans.name: Gai

texts.en: Gai is living in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Ghazanchi.  He is happily married with three sons (seven-year-old twins and a six-year-old).  Gai considers himself a hard worker and has been working on the family farm for the past ten years.  He has a high school education and would like his children to attend university.  Gai would like a loan to purchase materials to expand his cattle shed.  With the investment, he expects the family income to increase by twenty-five percent.  With some of the proceeds, Gai will do some remodeling of the family home.  He is pleased with the services of microfinance.

loans.use: to purchase materials to expand the cattle shed

loans.name: Samira

texts.ru: Samira yavlyayetsya IDP personom, ona pereselenec iz Khodjali , seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey sestroy. Samira 31 qod. Ona ne zamujem i ne imeyet detey. Ona uje 3 qoda kak zanimayetsya prodajey jenskoy kosmeticheskoy produkcii kak kraski dlya volos, maski dlya licca, shampuni, kremi i t. d. Samira nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit novuyu kosmeticheskuyu produkciyu dlya pereprodaji i razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en: Samira is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  She is a refugee from Khodjali who now lives in the Absheron region with her sister.  Samira is 31 years old.  She is not married and has no children.  For three years, she has been selling cosmetics like hair dye, facial masks, shampoo, creams, etc.  Samira needs 2300 AZN to buy new cosmetics for resale and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani is married with two sons and two daughters. Her sons are factory workers while her daughters stay at home and help Rani in her business and household work.
Rani does embroidery work from her home. She is very skillful and prepares beautiful embroidered dresses on order. She is also a very good housewife and performs her routine work very well. Her husband is involved in an animal sales business. He buys goats and sheep from the animal market at cheap rates, raises them up and sells them to customers at a profit. Rani has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband's business. With the loan, he will buy animals, like goats and sheep, for resale. He has been in this business for the past five years and Rani is hopeful that an investment will help him make better profits.

loans.use: to buy animals for her husband's animal sales business.

loans.name: Nabiha

texts.en:
Nabiha is 52 years old and the married mother of four children. To help provide for her family, she has worked baking special village bread for the past nine years. Nabiha also sells vegetables. To invest in her shop and improve it, she is requesting a loan from the Kiva Partner Al Majmoua to buy cement and building stones for necessary design improvements. She would like to partition her shop to separate her businesses and also provide space to create an additional business that will be a good investment to improve her family's social and financial situation.

Nabiha is a hardworking woman with an excellent reputation. She works hard to provide her family with their basic needs. Nabiha hopes her children will one day know how much she loves them and will take good care of her when she gets old. In the future, Nabiha hopes to expand her business and bring in more employees to help her.

loans.use: to buy cement and stone to improve her bakery

loans.name: Gyulab

texts.en:
Gyulab has a farm, where he breeds various farm animals: cows, sheep and a goat. He works very hard on his farm and thereby he is able to keep his family. To increase his family’s profit, Gyulab intends to organize potato growing on his farm. For that he is asking for a 600,000 Armenian drams loan to buy potato seedlings, fertilizer and diesel fuel to organize growing process. 

Gyulab is 39 years old. He lives in Zovaber village, Sevan area, with his wife and two sons, who are students.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings, fertilizer and diesel fuel to organize growing process.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Married to Ruth, Charles is 41 years and the father of three children who are attending school.  He has practised farming in the town of Olkalou for the last five years.  Charles was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, and this will be his fourth loan which he will use to buy potato seeds and fertilizer. His previous loans were paid well and in good time. In the future, Charles hopes to become a leading farmer in the Olkalou area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul, a married father of three children, all of whom attend school, lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and food for the family.

For the past two years, Paul has operated a grocery shop, selling to his neighbours and passersby. He faces the high cost of transportation as the major challenge in his business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business. With the Kshs 15,000 loan, he wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, vegetables, onions, garlic, potatoes and ground nuts.

Paul dreams of expanding his business and operating as a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, vegetables, onions, garlic, potatoes and ground nuts.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas has a mixed farm in the outskirts of Nyamira town in western Kenya. He has been in the farming business for 18 years and employs one farmhand. His farm produces maize, beans and milk, which are all sold locally. He earns additional income from his butcher shop in the same area.

Thomas has requested this loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from the sale of milk will help improve his farming activities, pay school fees for the kids and improve their living standards. He plans to expand his farming in the future by purchasing an additional piece of land and also buying two quality dairy cows. 

Thomas is 38 years old and married with two children, ages three and six, who both attend school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Abraham Plus Group

texts.en:
Abraham Plus is a group of 15 owners of small businesses chaired by Delly. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva through the MFI (Micro-Finance Institution) HOPE DRC to grow their businesses.

Delly is 44 years old. She operates a drugstore and sells soft drinks. She buys crates of soft drinks and resells them at a profit. She sells her products daily and nightly in her area.

Delly started her business in 2003. She is a trustworthy client of HOPE RDC, having five times obtained and correctly repaid loans. Her next loan will allow her to increase the inventory of her business by buying more antibiotics and crates of soft drinks to increase her sales in order to make a better profit. Delly makes a profit of about US$25 per day. She is married and the mother of six children, aged six months to 17 years. Four of them attend school. She is also taking care of her cousin and niece. Her ambition is to become a medicine wholesaler.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell at her drugstore and some crates of soft drinks for resale

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Zoya

texts.en: Zoya is from the village of Isahakyan in the Shirak region of Armenia. She really enjoys the nature of Isahakyan and the people in her village. Zoya has three children – a twenty-seven-year-old daughter and two sons (twenty-one and thirty). Her oldest son lives in Russia and she misses him dearly. Zoya and her husband have been working on the family farm for the past twenty years. They would like to expand their business. With a microfinance loan, she will purchase seeds, fertilizer, and fuel. This investment should increase the family income by twenty percent. The proceeds will be used to support their extended family and to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and fuel

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret lives in the Makerere neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. Margaret has a business selling used clothes. She has been in this business for 10 years and works seven days out of every week. Margaret sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale and retail. Margaret has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second hand clothes. She also generates additional income through rental rooms. The main business challenges for Margaret include rain, which hinders her customers ability to come to her, and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and build more rental rooms. Margaret lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 43-year-old man who has four children. His wife Rehab is a driving teacher. Having experience in this field (teaching driving), Khaled decided to open a school to teach driving and mechanicA. skills. Now his school, “Asem for Driving Teaching” as he called it, has been running for two years. During these two years, he has obtained over 10 cars to use to teach driving. 

Now Khaled has applied for a loan to add more cars and he want to improve the inside training rooms.

loans.use: To add more driver training cars and improve the training room decor .

loans.name: Wisam

texts.en:
Wisam is 38 years old and single. For the past five years, she has worked selling cotton clothes, lingerie, pajamas, and blankets. Wisam works hard to continually improve her business. She is a woman who likes to prove to others that she is capable of handling all the obstacles she might face running her business. 

During the past five years, Wisam has introduced her customers to different items season after season. She is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner Al Majmoua to expand her bridal lingerie and underwear department. In the future, Wisam hopes to open a large specialized wedding shop.

loans.use: to purchase bridal lingerie and underwear

loans.name: Mayrenik

texts.en: Mayrenik is living in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Metz Mantash.  She was born in Metz Mantash and has lived her entire life there.  The main activity in Mayrenik’s village is agriculture.  She has a high school education and has been farming with her husband for the past fifteen years.  She has two wonderful children – a twenty-one-year-old daughter and a twenty-year-old son.  Mayrenik hopes she will be able to support her children to help them finish their university education.  She would like a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer.  This investment should increase the family income by twelve percent.  Mayrenik is pleased with microfinance services and looks forward to the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a married man with 12 children. Two of his children attend school, three have cleared school and seven are working. They live at a house that they own, which does not have electricity or piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for his family. 

For the past year, he has operated a water distribution business, selling from home to his neighbors and passersby. Samuel faces a major challenge of water rationing by the water company, hence not meeting his customers' demand. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the 20,000 KES he wants to purchase water pumps for his water distribution business. He decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase water pumps for his water distribution business

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en: Hasmik is from the village of Hovouny in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is married with two children – a twenty-four-year-old daughter and a twenty-seven-year-old son.  Hasmik has a high school education and has been a private farmer for the past sixteen years.  In her village of Hovouny, she has many relatives and close friends.  Hasmik enjoys the fresh air and working the land.  In addition to her farming business, she helps her married daughter’s family with produce grown on her farm.  Hasmik would like a loan to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer.  According to her business plan, this investment will increase the family income by ten percent.  She will save some of the proceeds to remodel the family home.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Nzaro

texts.en:
Nzaro is a married a man with 15 children, 6 of whom still attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for his children.

Nzaro has been operating a quarry business for the last four years, selling to local residents in his area. In addition, he also operates a café business to earn additional income. Nzaro faces a major challenge in the seasonality of his business. During the December holidays, he has a lot of customers, but during the months of January to May he experiences low sales volume. Nzaro dreams of expanding his business and operating it as a wholesale business in the future.

With this loan for 20,000 KES, Nzaro wants to purchase a quarry machine and add food stock for his café business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his businesses.

loans.use: to buy a machine for his quarry business and add food stock for his café business

loans.name: Akouwa Kpatagnon

texts.fr: Femme de 32 ans, Akouwa est mariée et mère d’un enfant, revendeuse de produits cosmétiques et de tissus, elle s’approvisionne à Cotonou. Elle a mis cette activité en place depuis 2009 et maitrise bien  ce qu’elle fait. Ce premier prêt lui servira à acheter beaucoup plus d’articles pour élargir sa clientèle
texts.en: Akouwa is a 32-year old woman, who is married and mother to one child. She retails cosmetics and fabric and gets her supplies in Cotonou. She began this business in 2009 and masters it well. This first loan will enable her to buy a lot more articles so that she can expand her customer base.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and fabric

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Âgée de 39 ans, Madame Aminata vit dans une famille monogame avec son mari et ses  5 enfants dans le quartier Hamdallaye de la préfecture de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso).  
Elle n’ a pu faire d’études dû à des raisons sociales, elle s’est vite initiée aux activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa maman. Elle exerce diverses  activités génératrices de revenus  depuis maintenant 11 ans.  Elle est très bien sollicitée, a une bonne notoriété et reçoit des commandes à travers des associations féminines de son quartier.  
Pour l’élargissement et l’amélioration de son activité,  Madame n’a pas pris du temps pour faire recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 4 ans.  Après avoir pris 4 prêts solidaires ( prêt de groupe ) tous remboursés  correctement sans difficulté, elle est à son 4ème  prêt individuel, après avoir correctement remboursés les trois précédents. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter, 7 pièces de moyen riche, 2 kg de potasse et des différents colorants à Bamako.  Elle effectue son activité dans la ville de Koutiala  à une clientèle mixte au comptant et à crédit.   
Elle compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de  120.000 FCFA qu’elle envisage d’utiliser pour le remboursement des  taux d’intérêts de Soro Yiriwaso et participer aux dépenses quotidiens de sa famille. 
Avec ce financement elle espère que sa perspective sera bonne  et qu’elle parviendrait  à satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
39-year-old Madame Aminata lives in a monogamous family with her husband and their five children in the Hamdallaye neighborhood of the Koutiala prefecture (Sikasso region).  She was not able to study for social reasons, but began learning business early on with her mother.  She has been pursuing various moneymaking activities for almost 11 years.  She is very much in demand, has a good reputation, and receives orders through various women’s associations in her neighborhood.

To increase and improve her business, Madame did not delay in turning to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso four years ago.  After four group loans, all paid back correctly without difficulty, she is on her fourth individual loan, after correctly paying back her previous three loans.  With this new loan, she plans to buy seven pieces of damask fabric, two kilograms of potash, and various coloring agents in Bamako.  She runs her business in the town of Koutiala for customers paying both cash and credit.

She expects a monthly profit of 120,000 FCFA which she plans to use to repay Soro Yiriwaso’s interest and help pay her family’s expenses.  With this financing she hopes that her future will be good and that she will be able to meet her clients’ needs.

loans.use: to purchase dye ingredients.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is living in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Gtashen.  Anna was born in Gtashen and enjoys the nature, fresh air, and being close to her extended family.  Anna and her husband have been working on the family farm for the past twenty years.  She is very proud of her two sons (twenty-two and twenty-three years old) and looks forward to having grandchildren.  Anna would like a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and fuel.  She expects this investment in her business to increase the family income by twenty percent.  With microfinance services, she plans to continue expanding the family business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and fuel

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en: Ashraf is 44 years old. He is married to Aziza and has four children. He started a food business 16 years ago by building a restaurant. His restaurant basically provides traditional food like hummus, falafel, and sandwiches. After getting a lot of customers, he added a section for making different types of barbecue, Kabab, grilled chicken, steaks, etc. Because of his delicious food, good service and his generosity, people didn’t mind that he did not have a good seating area at the restaurant. They used to make take away orders so they wouldn't miss eating his food. Since it is better to eat steaks and grilled chicken when it is warm, Ashraf decided to apply for a loan to redecorate his seating area to give his customer the chance to eat the food while it is warm.

loans.use: To redecorate the seating area of his restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy néré nuts for making Sounbala

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en:
Mostafa is 58 years old and the married father of four children. For the past 41 years, he has worked making furniture. His extensive experience has earned his clients' trust and recommendations among his competitors. Mostafa opened his own factory in 1976 and has been developing and improving his business through the years.

Mostafa is requesting his third loan from the Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary wood to improve his furniture designs and increase his business. In the future, Mostafa hopes to continue to expand his business and provide a good heritage to his children for their future.

loans.use: to buy wood to improve and expand his furniture business

loans.name: Mohamadou

texts.fr:
Né vers 1970 à Djidieni préfecture de Kolokani, Monsieur Mohamadou est marié à une épouse, père de 4 enfants et vit chez lui même dans le quartier Koko de la préfecture de Koutiala. Après l’abandon de l’école coranique qu’il fréquenta jusqu’au niveau secondaire, Il s’intéresse à l’achat vente de colas  et diverses marchandises qu’il a appris  auprès de son  père il y a plus de 20 ans et l’exerce actuellement pour lui même au grand marché  de Koutiala depuis 10 ans.  Il est très sollicité lors  des foires hebdomadaires de Koutiala ville et environnants. 
Pour diversifier son activité, il décida de faire recours à l ‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a deux mois.  Il est à son 1er prêt individuel. Monsieur Mohamadou compte acheter 4 paniers de colas avec ce  prêt. Il s’approvisionnait  auprès des commerçants grossistes de Koutiala, mais avec l’augmentation du fonds de commerce, il compte aller à Bamako (capitale du Mali),  il  vend tous les jours ses colas dans le grand marché de Koutiala  à une clientèle composée de femmes et hommes  en espèce. Il espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90.000FCFA qu’il envisage utiliser pour rembourser l’échéance du prêt et utiliser  le reste pour payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants et prendre en charge sa famille.
texts.en:
Born near 1970 in the Djidieni prefecture of Kolokani, Mr. Mohamadou is a married father of four who lives in the Koko neighborhood of the Koutiala prefecture.  After leaving the Koranic school that he attended until the secondary level, he began selling kola nuts and various products, a business that he learned from his father over 20 years ago and has been practicing on his own in the Koutiala market for ten years.  He is in high demand in the weekly markets of Koutiala and the surrounding area.

To diversify his business, he decided to turn to the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso two months ago.  This is his first individual loan.  Mr. Mohamadou plans to buy four baskets of kola nuts with this loan.  He was buying his products from wholesale sellers in Koutiala, but with the increase in business funds, he plans to go to Bamako (the capital of Mali).  He sells his kola nuts every day in the Koutiala market to a customer base made up of women and men who pay in cash.  He hopes to make a monthly profit of 90,000 FCFA that he plans to use to pay back the loan, using the rest to pay his children’s school fees and care for his family.

loans.use: to buy baskets of kola nuts.

loans.name: Mher

texts.en: Mher is from the town of Artik in the Shirak region of Armenia.  He is happily married and has a ten-year-old son.  He considers himself a hardworking, honest person.  He was previously employed in a business selling produce, but now he has been running his own vegetable selling business for over a year.  He wants to save money for his son’s future and continue to grow his business.  Mher is looking for a loan to purchase additional inventory.  As sales have been good, he is planning to expand the business.  With the investment, Mher expects the family income to increase by fifteen percent.  He is satisfied with microfinance services and the terms.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory for his vegetable selling business

loans.name: Mwito Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kakuru est entrepreneur, leader du groupe d’affaire « Mwito »,  âgée de 39 ans, mariée, mère de 7 enfants. Son mari est un chômeur, sans emploi. La cliente est vendeuse petits poids, haricots et autres denrées alimentaires au marché central de Virunga.  Il ya 10 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle vient de réaliser 5 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Elle démarra son business avec  50$ reçu de son mari. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec  d’autres denrées alimentaires (50 kg petits poids, 50 kg de haricots, etc.) à marchander.  En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, scolariser ses enfants et construire une maison.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire «  Mwito» est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en: The client, Kakuru, is an entrepreneur, leader of the Mwito business group, 39 years old, married, and a mother of 7. Her husband is unemployed. The client sells peas, beans and other basic foods at the central market of Virunga. She’s been doing this for 10 years. She just fulfilled 5 loans with Hekima. She started her business with $50 from her husband. This new loan will help her stock up with other basic foods (50 kg of peas, 50 kg of beans, etc.) to sell. In addition, she envisions growing her business, sending her kids to school, and building a house. The client thanks Hekima for their actions to help the poor which are excluded from classic banks. It is worth noting that the Mwito business group is mostly female.

loans.use: to buy 50 kg of peas, 50 kg of beans, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Alice Murugi

texts.en:
Married to Joseph, who contributes to the family income, Alice Murugi is a 39-year-old mother of three children aged 15, 13, and 6 years of age. A retailer of clothes and shoes for the past three years, she earns a monthly income of KES.4,000. This will be her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member, and she will use it to purchase more stocks of shoes and clothes for her shop.

Her hope is to educate her children to a high level and provide them with a good standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of shoes and clothes for her shop.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère de 5 enfants, Madame Fatoumata est âgée de 43 ans,  elle vit avec son époux et leurs enfants dans le quartier Koko de la préfecture de Koutiala (région de Sikasso ). 
Pour des raisons sociales, Fatoumata n’a pas eu la chance de faire des études, alors elle s’est intéressée  aux activités génératrices de revenus depuis à bas âge. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle finit par se lancer dans la vente des bois de chauffe il y a  des décennies.  Madame Fatoumata trouve que cette activité lui procure bien de revenus et que ça marche très bien, puisqu’elle  parvient à vendre un chargement de remorque par semaine.  
Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle en quantité, augmenter la taille de son activité, elle décida de  faire recours à  l ‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a 2 ans. Elle est a son 3eme  prêt individuel et les deux précédents ont été correctement payés.   
Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter,  2 chargements de bois de chauffe dans un  village de Koutiala et effectue tous les jours sa vente  devant sa porte à une clientèle constituée  de femmes et d’hommes,  au comptant et à crédit.  
Elle compte  réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100.000FCFA par mois qu’elle envisage utiliser pour  le remboursement des intérêts, participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et investir le reste dans d’autres activités génératrices de revenus
texts.en:
Married and the mother of five children, Madame Fatoumata is 43 years old. She lives with her spouse and their children in the Koko neighborhood of the Koutiala prefecture (Sikasso region). 

For social reasons, Fatoumata did not have the opportunity to study, so she became interested in business at a young age. After trying several businesses without success, she began selling firewood decades ago. Madame Fatoumata finds that this business makes a good revenue and is going very well, as she is able to sell a trailer-load each week.

To satisfy her clients with more wood and increase the size of her business, she decided to seek assistance from the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso two years ago. She is on her third individual loan, and the two preceding ones were duly repaid.

With this loan she plans to buy two loads of firewood in the village of Koutiala. She sells daily in front of her home, for cash and credit to both men and women. She plans to make an average monthly profit of 100,000 CFA, which will be used to repay interest on the loan, help with the family's daily expenses, and invest in other income-generating activities.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy computer equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
Abdalla is a single man who owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 3 years, Abdalla has operated a boda boda (motorcycle transport) business, operating from door-to-door. His potential customers are the local residents. Abdalla faces the major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season, it becomes difficult to operate. He dreams of expanding his business and purchasing five motorcycles in the future. Abdalla plans to use this KES 10,000 loan to purchase spare parts to service his motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy biscuits, toothpaste, toothbrushes, cigarettes, etc. wholesale to add to his business

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris, 41 years old, is married to Peter and they have five school-going children. Peris has been selling different types of used clothing in Ndunyu Njeru for the last nine years.

Peris was introduced to KADET LTD. by one of her friends and this will be her third loan. She repaid all her previous loans well and in good time. Peris plans to use the loan amount to buy more bedsheets to sell as her stock is running out. In the future, Peris hopes to grow her business and move into a more permanent place.

loans.use: To buy bedsheets to sell

loans.name: Muhidin

texts.en:
Muhidin is very dedicated and has much experience in the livestock business. He supports his spouse and two children and also provides for their education. It is important to note that, thanks to his hard work, he has been able to give his children his support so that they can get ahead. Muhidin is hoping for the support of IMON to obtain a loan of $3000 USD to purchase young cattle to increase his livestock and to earn more. Both Muhidin and his loving family will benefit from this loan.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase cattle to expand his business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pepper, margi, rice, palm oil, etc. in large quantities.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Résidant à Bè kpota(un quartier  du pays), Mme Ablavi est  mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Elle se donne à l’activité de revendeuse de pipettes et de sacs   depuis 2004 après avoir acheté au Grand Marché de Lomé. Ce premier prêt  lui servira à acheter  les articles afin de satisfaire ses nombreuses clientes.
texts.en: Mme Ablavi lives in Bè Kpota (an area of Togo), and is married with two children. She has sold pipettes and bags for a living since 2004. She sources these goods from Lomé's main market. This loan will enable her to purchase greater volumes of these products so that she can meet her customers' rising demand.

loans.use: to purchase pipettes and bags

loans.name: Inomjon

texts.en: Inomjon is 30 years old, married and has three children. He has a secondary education and has an animal-husbandry business. He has a small cow-house where he breeds calves. Because he does not have a specialized education, animal husbandry is the only source of income for his family. Inomjon buys calves on the market at a low price, feeds them and then resells on the same market at a more profitable price. He provides the markets with meat and his family with the necessary food. Inomjon wants to buy young cattle and needs money, so he decided to apply for a loan. He is very grateful to all those who can support him. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which being includes a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase young cattle

loans.name: Tatayyira Group

texts.en:
Maseray is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Born 30 years ago in Matotoka village, Maseray is married to a trader and has two children who are attending primary school. For many years now, Maseray has been selling palm oil (the most popular cooking oil). With her share of this loan, Maseray is going to buy gallons of palm oil to add to her business. 

This is the first loan that Maseray and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and, consequently, improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy gallons of palm oil to add to her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dairy cows and cultivate her farm

loans.name: Ikromiddin

texts.en:
Ikromiddin is 37 years old. He is married and is the father of 3 children. Ikromiddin owns a grocery store and provides for his family with the revenues generated from this store. He is requesting a loan of US$1800 to increase his stock of foodstuff in his grocery.  Ikromiddin is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. One of his dreams is that his children progress through their studies, and he is doing his best to help them.  We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his business.       

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need.
