loans.use: stock more inventory for his store

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 40 years old, married, and has 4 children -- 2 of them go to school.  Jane sells soft drinks to earn income.  She has borrowed a loan to stock more soft drinks to sell.  She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits generated.

loans.use: stock more soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy "pagnes" for resale

loans.name: Celina

texts.en: Celina is 30 years old.  She is married and has 5 children -- 3 of them go to school.  Celina sells onions, groundnuts and tomatoes.  She has borrowed a loan to stock more onions, groundnuts and tomatoes to sell.  She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits generated.

loans.use: stock more onions, groundnuts and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is 38 yrs old.  He is married to Jacinta, who is a farmer and also contributes to the family income.  They have four children.  He has been farming for sixteen years and earns an income of KES 20,700 monthly.

He has taken his second loan after repaying the previous one successfully. He wants use this loan to  spray his crops and buy fertilizer.  His hope is to expand his farm and improve his family's living standard.

loans.use: spray his crops and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Fousseni

texts.fr: Père de 03 enfants, fousseni est âgé de45 ans et marié à une revendeuse. Pour son activité il a eu la brillante idée de vendre des timbres fiscaux vers le port pour les légalisations des pièces dans le déroulement des dédouanements des marchandises et faciliter la tache aux transitaires, et pour cela il s’approvisionne à la mairie, il est également agent de police au commissariat du port .il a commencé cette activité depuis 1986.il souhaiterait s’approvisionner plus en timbre d’où ce deuxième crédit.
texts.en: Fousseni is 45 years old, married to a retailer and father to three children. He had the brilliant idea of setting up a business selling stamps for official documents near the port and he provides these for legalising papers as part of the customs clearance process, easing the task for freight brokers. To do this he gets his supplies of stamps from the town-hall. He is also a police officer at the port's police station. He began this activity in 1986. He would like to get more supplies of stamps and for this reason is requesting a second loan.

loans.use: to buy stamps for official documents

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 24 years old and single. For the past four years he has worked in the electrician field. He loves this field and it was his major during his studies at a nearby college. He would like to make it his lifetime career. Ahmad has a good reputation and is an energetic hard worker who is young enough to handle all of the work he gets. He believes he must take advantage of his age and good health to create a good customer base and make a place in the market. 

Ahmad is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy new advanced and updated tools and machines to help improve the quality of his work and ability to take on as many projects as he can get. Ahmad hopes that through improving his business he will be able to save some money and build his own house to support a small family such as everyone dreams about. In the future, he also hopes to expand his business and open an electrical supply shop.

loans.use: to buy new and updated tools and machines

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 47 years old.  He is married to Agnes and they have four children.  He has been practicing farming in Olkalou town for the last five years.   

Julius was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers.  This will be his first loan.  He plans to use this loan to buy potato seeds and fertilizer, and to pay for labour.

In the future, Julius hopes to grow into large-scale farming and also to open a timberyard.

loans.use: buy seeds & fertilizer and to pay for labour

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda is married and has two grown children. She lives in Novaya Kahovka. Nadezhda sells clothing at one of the local market places in her home town. She has been in this business for 16 years. Currently, her turnover capital amounts to 21,500 Grivnyas, and her net profit is 6,000 Grivnyas a month. Nadezhda has 40,000 Grivnyas worth of inventory. 

Nadezhda is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase a new assortment of summer inventory: shorts, T-shirts, swimming suits, hats, etc.  She is an experienced entrepreneur who understands market demand and uses her knowledge to attract more customers. Nadezhda says her business is the main source of income for her family, which is why she works hard to keep it running efficiently and bring in a stable income.

loans.use: stock an assortment of summer clothes to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 48 years old.  She is married and has 5 children.  Two of her children are currently at university, one has completed college, one is in high school, and the youngest one is in primary school.  

Alice currently earns 16,000 KES a month from the milling business she has been running for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of KES 50,000 to buy more  maize for her milling business. This is her 2nd loan with KADET. She plans to use the proceeds to pay for her children’s education. Alice hopes to start a large business in the maize flour milling and packing industry.

loans.use: buy more maize for her milling business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 35 years old.  She is married and has 2 children.  Her children are 7 and 2 years old. She has been running her hardware business for 1 year and has requested a loan for 60,000 KES to buy additional stock for her business. This includes more tiles, sinks, toilet basins, pipes, electrical equipment, etc.  

Jane has been a good client who repays her loan well. This is her 2nd loan with KADET. She plans to use her profits from her business to pay for her children’s education. In the future, she hopes to expand her small hardware business into a large hardware store where she will begin selling more items such as cement.

loans.use: buy additional stock for her hardware business

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 41 years old.  She is married to James and together they have 4 children between 6 months and 18 years old.  Caroline has been running her coffee shop for 6 years and earns 6000 KES a month. She has requested to borrow 15,000 KES to buy sugar, tea, and coffee for her coffee shop.

Caroline has been a good client who repays her loan well. This is her 2nd loan with KADET. She plans to use the proceeds from this loan to expand her business and pay for her children’s education. She hopes to venture into real estate and educate her children to the college level.

loans.use: buy sugar, tea and coffee for her coffee shop

loans.name: Lerina

texts.en:
Lerina is 34 years old, married and blessed with two children.  He is a farmer and has been doing this for the last three years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for maize farming.  He learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. 

This will be Lerina's second loan, which he is planning to use for maize seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his wheat production and to educate his children.  His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land and build a permanent home.

loans.use: buy maize seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy cooking fat, oil, and other items for her shop

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 49 years old. She is married to Paul and they have six children. She has operated her retail shop in Naivasha town for the last three years. She also plants produce in her farm during the planting season to sell.   

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of her friends and this will be her second loan. She paid her previous loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting and also to pay for labor. She sells her produce in the Naivasha market.

In the future, Mary hopes to become a leading farmer in Naivasha town and also grow her retail business to wholesale.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting her farm.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 43 years old and married. She has been running her own shop for four years. Josephine earns around 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) a month and hopes to own a big shop in the future. 

Josephine has been a good client who repays her loans well. This is her fifth loan with KADET. Josephine intends to take a 40,000 KES loan to buy cooking oil, sugar, tea leaves and flour for her shop. As a hardworking individual, she plans to use the proceeds from this loan to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sugar, tea leaves, and flour for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, palm oil, gari, groundnuts, etc., in bulk to add to her business.

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en: This client is engaged in furniture production and trading. He owns a furniture shop. In order to increase the variety of furniture and meet the customers' demands, the client also imports furniture from abroad. He has applied for this loan to cover the customs fees for recently imported furniture. The loan will help the client run his business smoothly and successfully.

loans.use: to pay for customs fees for imported furniture

loans.name: Anaam

texts.en:
Anaam is a 35-year-old mother of three children, married to a driver. Anaam wanted to help her husband support the family so she decided to start a poultry breeding business.

A year ago, Anaam bought a special container for eggs, ducks and chickens and allocated a room outside her house for the poultry breeding business, Depending on the productivity of the chickens, she has been selling eggs and breeding new chicks. Now Anaam is applying for a loan to buy a special electro-heating machine to hatch the eggs.

loans.use: To buy a special electro-heating machine to hatch eggs.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is a married woman with five adult-aged children. She is 58 years old and has had a food selling business for seven years.

Visitacion sells fruits and vegetables like bananas, cabbage, tomatoes, carrots and potatoes to the people in her community. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 monthly.

Visitacion is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase bananas, cabbage, tomatoes and carrots.

In the future, Visitacion hopes that her business as well as the general living condition of her family will improve.

loans.use: To purchase bananas, cabbage, tomatoes and carrots to sell

loans.name: Chaka

texts.en:
Chaka is a married man who has 2 school-going children.  His family lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are rent and school fees.

For the past 2 years, Chaka has been operating a food café business, selling to his neighbours and passersby. Chaka faces a major challenge in the seasonality of his business. He dreams of establishing a restaurant in the future.

With this loan for Kshs 20,000, Chaka wants to purchase wheat flour, beans, vegetables, tomatoes and rice for his café business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: buy wheat flour, beans, vegetables, tomatoes and rice for his café

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy more firewood and palm oil to sell

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud is 51 years old.  He is married to Monica, who also contributes to the family income. He has two children aged 23 and 20.  Eluid is a farmer and has been growing coffee for a period of about eight years, earning an income of KES 7,000 a month.

This is Eliud's second loan from KADET after successfully repaying his previous one. He has requested this loan to pay school fees for his children. 

His hope is to enhance his children’s future dreams and improve their living standard.

loans.use: pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is 39 years old.  He is married to Nancy, who also contributes to the family income.  Moses has been running his grocery store for a period of about ten years and earns an income of KES 14,000 a month.   This is his fourth loan with KADET after successfully repaying the previous ones.  Moses wants to use this loan to buy stock of clothes and vegetables for his store.  His dream is to be a wholesaler of new clothing.

loans.use: buy stocks of clothes and vegetables for his store

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in  Uganda. She is married and has 7 children, five of whom are in school. Rose lives in a home that she owns; she doesn't have access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.   

Rose has operated a market stall business for 10 years, working 6 days a week. She has requested for a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. The main business challenges for Rose include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and hopes for her business are to see it grow big, to own a delivery van and to build her own rooming house .

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Rania

texts.en: Rania is a 25-year-old mother of two beautiful girls. She has been married to Mohammad, a salesman, since 2007 and has been living in a rented house in Al Zarqa. Rania is a very ambitious young lady who saw the opportunity to start a small retail business at home selling clothes five years ago. During these five years, she added home products as another thing that she sells. Now Rania has applied for a loan to add more variety in the clothes she sells so she can save enough money from the profit to open her own independent store.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of clothes to sell

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is a dairy farmer from Nyamira in western Kenya. He has been in the farming business for 20 years and sells his milk to the local market. He earns additional income from his small scale farming of tea, coffee, bananas and sugarcane, which are all sold locally. 

Jeremiah has requested a loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will enable him to pay school fees for his children and improve his family's livelihood. He faces the challenges of diseases and lack of capital for expansion. He plans to expand his farming in the future by acquiring another piece of land.

Jeremiah is 42 years old and married, with 4 children whose ages range between 17 and 23. Three of the children are currently attending school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase books, pens, pencils and rulers for sale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 50 years old, married to John, and they have four school-going children. Margaret has practised farming in Olkalou for the last few years.  

Margaret was introduced to KADET LTD. by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use it to plant potatoes during this rainy season, so she's planning to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for labor. In the future, Margaret hopes to buy more land and practice large scale farming in Olkalou.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul has practised potato farming in Olkalou for the last 11 years. He is 47 years old, married to Lydia and they have 4 school-going children.  

Paul was introduced to KADET by one of his friends and this will be his first loan. He plans to use it to buy potato seeds and fertilizer for planting and to do top dressing. In the future, Paul hopes to practise large scale farming and to start dairy farming on his farm

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer and to do top dressing.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is 32 years old and married to Edward who contributes to the family income. 

Monicah has been running a retail shop for a period of about three years, with an income of approximately 5,000 Kenyan shillings a month.

This is her first loan with KADET which she wants to use to buy sugar, rice and cooking fat to restock her shop. 

She hopes to become a wholesaler and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice and cooking fat for her shop.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a single man who lives in his own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, Robert has run a carpentry business, selling from door to door to his neighbours and passersby. 

Robert faces a major challenge in the seasonality of sales and failing to get contracts from his customers. He dreams of expanding his business and wokrking with long-term contracts in the future. He has decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings he has asked for, he wants to purchase equipment for his carpentry business.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard is 50 years old, married to Jecinta and they have six children. He has practised farming in Olkalou for the last three years. Bernard was introduced to KADET LTD. by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use it to buy a dairy cow, fertilizer and potato seeds and to pay for labor. In the future, Bernard hopes to buy more land and practice large scale farming.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow, fertilizer and potato seeds and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 44 years old and married. She supports 8 members of her family and is blessed with seven children aged 23, 19, 16, 14, 12, 9 and 5 years old. Rosa has been selling secondhand clothes in Languse trading centre for one year, earning a monthly income of KES 1,000.

Rosa has borrowed a loan of KES 7,500 from KADET LTD. This is her first loan and she wishes to use it to purchase one bale of secondhand clothes for resale. The profits generated from the loan will be used to pay her children's school fees. Rosa hopes to expand her business to greater heights and have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase one bale of secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Mercy Wanjiru

texts.en: Mercy is a 28-year-old single woman who has been selling new clothes for about two years, earning a monthly income of KES 12,000. This is her first loan from KADET, after being introduced by group members. She wants to use it to buy shoes to sell in her shop. Mercy hopes to grow her business into a big boutique and improve her living standard.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make renovations to the store and to purchase additional stock.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has two children.  Sylvia has a business of a boutique that sells clothes, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Sylvia has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sylvia hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Sylvia hopes to take care of herself.  Sylvia is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save money.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Regina Njeri

texts.en:
Regina Njeri is 32 years old and married to Alex, who contributes to the family income. She has 4 children, aged 12, 9, 6, and 1 years old. Regina has been operating her restaurant for about 11 years, earning a monthly income of 5,000 KES.

Regina is taking her first loan with KADET after being introduced by a staff member. She wants to use the loan to buy some dishes for keeping food hot and to improve her hotel kitchen. She hopes to build rental houses and improve her living standard.

loans.use: to buy some dishes for keeping food hot and to improve her hotel kitchen.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Caroline has a business of selling clothes, which she has had for two years.  She also has a second business of arts and crafts.  

To help expand her business, Caroline has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Caroline hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Caroline hopes to expand both of her businesses.   Caroline is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her get more capital to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Shamim has a business of a small hotel that sells food, which she has had for eight years.         

To help expand her business, Shamim has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more food for cooking for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Shamim hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Shamim hopes to pay for her house rent.  Shamim is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by enabling her to gain new friends.

loans.use: to purchase more food to cook and resell.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a single man who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is his upkeep.

For the past year, Samuel has operated a bread distribution business, selling from door-to-door to his local retail operators. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. Samuel dreams of expanding and establishing his own bakery firm in the future. He plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase bundles of bread for sale. He decided to join Yehu because of their variety of loan products.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of bread for sale.

loans.name: Rashidah

texts.en:
Rashidah is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Rashidah has a business of selling food, which she has had for three years.

To help expand her business, Rashidah has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more food for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rashidah hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Rashidah hopes to start a business of selling charcoal.  Rashidah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save money.

loans.use: to purchase more food for resale.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children.  None of her children is currently in school.  Betty has a business of outside catering, which she has had for one year.         

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more food for cooking for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Betty hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Betty hopes to own a retail shop.  Betty is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her to be hardworking.

loans.use: to purchase more food for cooking for resale.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia is a married woman with three adult-aged children. She is 60 years old and has had a business selling fruits and vegetables for 13 years. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 monthly.
 
Lucrecia is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase potatoes, bananas, tomatoes, cabbage and squash to sell.

In the future, Lucrecia hopes that her business will become more progressive to be able to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, bananas, tomatoes, cabbage and squash to sell

loans.name: Mastula

texts.en:
Mastula is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has two children.  None of her children is currently in school.  Mastula has a business of a small retail shop, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Mastula has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities for resale and also to buy a fridge.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Mastula hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Mastula hopes to buy a fridge.   Mastula is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her improve in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities for resale and buy a fridge.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans has a mixed farm that produces maize, bananas, napier grass and milk. He has been in the farming business for ten years and employs one farmhand. Evans earns additional income from his shoe business in Nyamira, western Kenya. His biggest challenge in farming has been diseases which affect his production.

Evans has requested this loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will help improve his family's livelihood. He would like to expand his farm in the future by acquiring at least 3 acres of land and buying 5 high breed dairy cows. 

Evans is 33 years old and married, with a 4-year-old child who attends school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Chamreoun

texts.en:
Chamreoun, 43, resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Chamreoun is a construction worker, earning an income of $5 per day to help cover the family expenses. His wife is a tailor, earning an income of $4 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $80 on food and $37 on the other necessary expenses. 

Chamreoun is requesting a loan of $700 to finish the construction of his house. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to finish the construction of his house.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has one child, who is not currently in school.  Peninah has a business of a boutique that sells clothes, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Peninah has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Peninah hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her siblings.  In the future, Peninah hopes to own a bar.  Peninah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her start a business of her own.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov, 23, resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Pov is employed at the garment factory, earning an income of $2.66 per day to help cover the family expenses. Her husband is a fisherman, earning an income of $1.43 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $60 on food and $10 on the other necessary expenses. 

Pov is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase cows to raise for sale. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner. Her husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy cows to raise for sale.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has one child, who is currently in school.  Harriet has a business of selling clothes, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Harriet hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself.  In the future, Harriet hopes to expand her business.  Harriet is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her get capital to start a business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Reoun

texts.en:
Reoun, 70, resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Reoun grows vegetables to sell, earning an income of $1.86 per day to help cover the family expenses. Her daughter is employed at the factory, earning an income of $2.66 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $66 on food and $15 on the other necessary expenses. 

Reoun is requesting a loan of $1,200 to help one of her children to get married. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to help one of her children to get married.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Stella has a business of a small retail shop, which she has had for one year.         

To help expand her business, Stella has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Stella hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Stella hopes to own a bar.  Stella is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her to be hardworking.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, cooking oil and tissue paper.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has one child, who is not currently in school.  Edith has a business of selling clothes, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Edith has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Edith hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Edith hopes to own a salon.        Edith is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her positive behaviors through life planning skills.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Inn

texts.en:
Inn, 63, resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Inn and his wife are farmers, earning an income of $3.55 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $50 on food and $16 on the other necessary expenses. 

Inn is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase cows to help plow the rice field. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy cows to help plow the rice field.

loans.name: Ros

texts.en:
Ros, 62, resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia – an area known for palm products. Ros is a farmer, earning $1.50 US per day to help cover the family's expenses. Her husband is a traditional musician, earning $4 US per day. Each month, the family has to spend $90 US on food and $10 US on other expenses. 

Ros is requesting a loan of $1200 US to purchase a plot of farmland to improve the family's farming. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has three children.  Two of her children are currently in school.  Harriet has a business of selling passion fruits wholesale. She has had this business for two years.         

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more passion fruits for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Harriet hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Harriet hopes to own a plot of land and build a house.  Harriet is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her get more capital that has improved her business.

loans.use: to purchase more passion fruits for resale.

loans.name: Nat

texts.en:
Nat is 46 years old.  She resides in Kampong Chnang province in Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Nat sells fruits, earning an income of USD 7 per day to help cover her family's expenses. Her husband is a taxi driver, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Each month, the family must spend USD 100 on food and USD 20 on other necessary expenses. 

Nat is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a stand at the market to sell fruits. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy a stand at the market to sell fruits

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children, who are both currently in school.  Rose has a business of selling cold drinks, which she has had for five years.         

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase a fridge for storing more drinks for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rose hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Rose hopes to own a small retail shop.  Rose is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her improve in her business.

loans.use: to purchase a fridge for storing more drinks for resale.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is married and 55 years old. She raises pigs to sell in the future. Merlita had this business for 13 years.

Merlita is requesting a loan of PHP 23,000 to buy feeds and vitamins needed for the pigs. Each month, Merlita earns about PHP 7,000 doing this type of work.

In the future, Merlita hopes that her business will improve so that she can sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Savorn

texts.en:
Savorn is 59 years old.  She resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Savorn sells fish, earning an income of USD 3.33 per day to help cover her family's expenses. Her husband is a recycler, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 60 on food and USD 28 on other necessary expenses.

 Savorn is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike for her family's use. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Lizeth

texts.es:
Lizeth nació en el distrito de Calca provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco (Calca se encuentra a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco), ella tiene 23 años edad. Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad de donde nació. (La ciudad de Calca caracteriza por tener hermosos paisajes por ser una zona turística, ganadera y agrícola). Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Clorinda Matto de Turner” de la Asociación Arariwa. 
   
Lizeth es profesora y trabaja en el colegio particular “San Toribio de Mogrovejo” de la ciudad de Calca. Ya es un año que trabaja en dicha institución y le va muy bien. Ella actualmente es sus tiempos libres se dedica a la elaboración de su tesis pues se quiere graduarse para obtener el título profesional de Educación. Ella también nos cuenta que tiene un pequeño negocio familiar que consiste en vender productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y otras cosas más. Ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes que está ubicado en su domicilio y esta implementado con las necesidades básicas. 
Con este préstamo de USD. 500 dólares surtirá su negocio con más productos, comprará por ejemplo arroz, cocoa, aceite, leche en tarros, insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes y otros productos para mantener contenta a su clientela.

Lizeth es una mujer luchadora y su sueño es hacer una maestría. Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Asociación Arariwa por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de poder hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Lizeth was born in Calca District, Calca Province in Cusco Department.  (Calca is located 45 minutes from the city of Cusco.)  She is 23 years old.  She is currently living in the city of her birth.  (The city of Calca is characterized by having beautiful scenic spots and for being a center of tourism, cattle raising and farming.)  She is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Clorinda Matto de Turner” communal bank.

Lizeth is a teacher working at the “San Toribio de Mogrovejo” private school in Calca.  She’s been working at said institution for a year and does very well.  In her spare time she is busy writing her thesis because she wants to graduate to obtain a professional title in Education.  She also tells us that she has a small family business which consists in the sale of basic need items like rice, sugar, noodles and other things, for example.  She has a small home-based grocery store stocked with basic need items.

She will use this 500USD loan to stock the store with more products.  For example, she will buy rice, cocoa, oil, jugs of milk, personal hygiene supplies, home cleaning supplies, packets of soft drinks and other products to keep her customers happy.

Lizeth is a tenacious woman whose dream is to get a Master’s Degree.  She is very grateful to the Asociación Arariwa Movement for helping women like her to have opportunities to make their dreams a reality.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Saheoun

Saheoun is requesting a loan of USD 1100 to help one of her children get married. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: pay for her child to get married

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 52-year-old married man, and father of 4 children. Working in candies and canned foods since 2008, Ali also sells chips and chocolate. He uses his car to transport goods to grocery stores all over the region. His goA. is to improve his business and at the same time, improve his family's income and sociA. situation. 

Ali is requesting a loan from Kiva Partner A. Majmoua, in order to increase his juice and soft drinks capitA. for the summer season. This is Ali's 4th cycle with A. Majmoua, and he's a borrower in good standing.

Ali hopes to expand his business more and more in the future and to open a big warehouse for his wholesale trade.

loans.use: to increase his juice and soft drinks capital for the summer season

loans.use: stock more alcohol to sell

Zaina is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her more skills on how to budget.

Harriet is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has two children, who are both currently in school.  Harriet has a business selling cold drinks, which she has had for five years.         

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more soft drinks for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Harriet hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Harriet hopes to own a bar.  Harriet is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her get enough capital that has helped pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina lives in Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (in-laws).  

Madina has a retail shop business.  She has been in this business for 10 years and works 6 days out of every week. Madina sells her products by means of retail.    

Madina has requested a loan of 1000000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil. The main business challenges for Madina include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow bigger, to own her own delivery van, and to start selling wholesale only.   

Madina lives in a home that she rents.  She does not have access to electricity nor to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: buy more soap, sugar, salt, and cooking oil to sell

loans.use: to stock more fish to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more bread for resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 40 years old.  She is married and has 9 children, only 5  of whom go to school.   Elizabeth sells soft drinks and has borrowed a loan to stock more soft drinks to sell.  She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits.

loans.use: stock more soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Loyce

texts.en:
Loyce is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 2 years, Loyce has been operating a clothes vending business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. Loyce faces a major challenge in the seasonality of her business. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a boutique shop in the future.

With the loan for Kshs 20,000, Loyce wants to purchase bundles of clothes to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Severo

texts.es: El sr. Severo vive  en la localidad de San José  hace 15 años, su actividad es el servicio de  fabricación  de botas el realiza botas a pedido también los ofrece en el los mercados de Santa Cruz, tiene también un taller mecánico del cual los dos hijos se hacen cargo del servicio y así de esta manera poder colaborar con sus hijos que también tienen familia, conviven con la Sra. Isabel ella le ayuda en el trabajo de comercializar las botas que el Sr. Severo fabrica  tienen casa propia, con el dinero de el crédito el Sr. Severo realizara el mantenimiento de la maquinaria que usa para su trabajo, es una  persona responsable y trabajadora su deseo del Sr. Es el mantener a su familia unida y ver crecer a sus nietos, esta agradecido con nuestra entidad por haber confiado en el y brindarle un apoyo económico.
texts.en:
Severo has been living in the town of San José for 15 years.  His business is making boots.  He makes boots to order and also sells them in the markets in Santa Cruz.  Severo also has an auto repair shop which his two children are in charge of running.  In this way, he is able to help his children who have their own families.  Severo lives with Isabel who helps him in his work selling the boots that he makes.  They own their own home.

Severo will use his loan money to have maintenance work done on the machinery that he uses in his business.  He is a responsible and hard-working person whose wish is to keep his family united and watch his grandchildren grow up.  He is grateful to our organization for having trusted in him and provided him with financial support.

loans.use: to have maintenance work done on the machinery in his workshop

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children, who are all currently in school.  Shamim has a business of selling clothes, which she has had for three years.         

To help expand her business, Shamim has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Shamim hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself.  In the future, Shamim hopes to own a retail shop.  Shamim is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her learn new games like indoor and outside games.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Carolina Enriqueta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac; en la provincia de Cusco,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia  Carolina, la socia  tiene 58 años de edad y La socia es casada; La socia  tiene 3 hijos, de 33, 29, 26 de edad;  La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la administración y atención personal de sus tienda de abarrotes, la socia desea implementar dicha tienda y poder comprar productos de primera necesidad; arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, aceite. La socia tiene  una tienda de abarrotes; la socia comprara los productos de primera necesidad para implementar su tienda. La socia solicita el préstamo del crédito para invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para su tienda de abarrotes.
 
La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito que le otorgarán y de este modo podrá  mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Carolina, 58, is a member of the “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS” (Let’s Walk Together) communal bank.  She lives in Huanchac District which is in Cusco Province and Department.

She is married and has three children who are 33, 29 and 26 years of age.  She alternates her household chores with tending to her grocery store.  She wants to stock the store and be able to buy basic need items like rice, sugar, milk and oil.  She has a grocery store and will buy basic need items to stock her store.  She requests the loan to buy basic need items to stock her grocery store.

She values the loan and is infinitely grateful for the loan that will be granted her so that she can improve her quality of life.  At the same time, she commits to repay the loan in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy 10 bags of Omena (fish) to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothes and cell phone airtime cards to resell

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac; en la provincia de Cusco,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia  Albertina, la socia  tiene47 años de edad y La socia es casada; La socia  tiene 2 hijos, de 20 y 13 años de edad;  La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la administración de su automóvil la socia tiene con su conyugue un carro que ambos adquirieron y el esposo  presta el servicio de taxi, la socia desea el crédito para poder invertir en la compra del SOAT. Que es el seguro para cubrir a los pasajeros de accidentes; la socia desea invertir en la compra del seguro para proteger a los pasajeros que su esposo les preste el servicio de taxi, dentro de la ciudad del Cusco. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra del seguro contra accidentes para su auto.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito que le otorgarán y de este modo podrá  mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Albertina, 47, is a member of the “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS” communal bank.  She lives in Huanchac District which is in Cusco Province and Department.

She is married and has two children who are 20 and 13 years of age.  She alternates her household chores with administering an automobile she has with her spouse that they bought together and her husband uses to provide taxi services.  She wants the loan to buy a SOAT, which is an insurance policy to cover passengers in accidents.  She wants to invest in the purchase of the insurance to protect the passengers her husband transports within the city of Cusco.  She is asking for the loan to invest in the purchase of an accident insurance policy for her vehicle.

She values and is infinitely thankful for the loans she’ll be granted so that she can improve her quality of life.  She also commits to repay the loan in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy automobile accident insurance.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 37-year-old married man, and father of three children. He has owned a pet shop specializing in birds and fish since mid-2010. Hussein's favorite hobby was raising birds and fish, that's why he invested his hobby in a small shop he opened almost a year and a half ago.

Hussein's initial work is in a car rental business he started in 1995. He also works in selling Hookas. He believes that to make a good living, you have to search for several sources of income and that's what he's doing. 

Hussein is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to improve the pet store through buying necessary food for both fish and birds in addition to vases, cages and many other pet needs. This is his first time to request a loan, but he feels it's going to be a good step for his business to improve more and more.

loans.use: to purchase necessary items for his pet store

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 61 years old and married with four adult-aged children. She earns PHP 4,000 per month as a farmer working in the Philippines.

Erlinda has been growing corn for 25 years. She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fertilizers and seeds.

In the future, Erlinda hopes that her farming business will become progressive to be able to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy hair pieces and chemicals

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac; en la provincia de Cusco,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia  Norma, la socia  tiene 27 años de edad y La socia es conviviente; La socia  tiene 1 hijo, de 3 años de edad;  La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista la socia tiene en el mercado un stand en él la socia vende granos secos maíz de diferentes tipos, cereales, papa deshidratada, habas. Estas muchas veces sirven para semillas y los clientes compran para sembrar. La socia desea invertir el préstamo que le otorgaran en la compra de productos secos al por mayor para poder abastecerse. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos secos.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito que le otorgarán y de este modo podrá  mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Norma, 27, is a member of the “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS” communal bank.  She lives in Huanchac District which is in Cusco Province and Department.

She has a spouse and a 3-year-old son.  She alternates her household activities with retail sales.  She has a stand in the market where she sells dry grains of different types: cereals, dehydrated potato, broad beans.  Often these are used as seeds and customers buy them to plant.  She wants to invest the loan she’s granted to buy dry products at wholesale to stock up.  She is asking for the loan to buy dry goods.

She values and is infinitely thankful for the loans she’ll be granted so that she can improve her quality of life.  She also commits to repay the loan in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy dry goods.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 36 years old and married. She has four school-aged children. Emelyn has a food stall where she sells cooked food in the community.

Emelyn has had this business for four years and she earns approximately PHP 5,000 monthly. She is asking for a loan of PHP 9,000 to purchase additional cooking ingredients to cook more dishes to sell.

In the future, Emelyn hopes that her business will improve to be able to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional cooking ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy tomatoes, potatoes, bananas and onions

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: La señora Marlene oriunda de la Colonia  San Carlos a unos 15 kilómetros de la  localidad de San Jose, tiene casa propia que con mucho trabajo consiguió comprarse, su actividad es la venta de zapatos ella vende en la feria barrio lindo y mercado de la Zona,  convive con el Sr.  Luis el cual es motosierrista tienen 3 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, con el dinero del crédito la Sra. Marlene comprara vidrios para las ventanas de su casita ya que por esta época de invierno el frio  esta fuerte, la Sra. es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, su deseo es el de ver a sus hijos profesionales y personas de bien,  agradecida con la institución por el apoyo económico que le brinda para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marlene is from the small village of San Carlos, some 15km from the town of San José.  She owns her own home which she managed to buy with a lot of hard work.

Marlene's business is selling shoes.  She sells her products in Barrio Lindo street market and in the regional market.  She lives with her partner Luis, who is a chainsaw operator, and has three school-age children.  Marlene will use her loan money to buy panes of glass for the windows in her small home because in the winter it is bitterly cold.  Marlene is a very hard-working and responsible person whose wish is to see her children become professionals and upstanding citizens.  She is grateful to the institution for the financial support that they have offered her and which will help her to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy panes of glass for the windows in her home

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es:
Asunta nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco y tiene 49 años edad. (Paucartambo se encuentra a 3 horas de la ciudad del Cusco). Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad de Calca y está casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos. (La ciudad de Calca caracteriza por tener hermosos paisajes por ser una zona turística, ganadera y agrícola). Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Clorinda Matto de Turner” de la Asociación Arariwa.  
  
Asunta se dedica a la compra y venta de maíz, ella comprar maíz de diferentes lugares como por ejemplo de Calca, Urubamba y Lares. Ella con el maíz elabora jora de maíz para vender a sus vecinas o compañeras del banco comunal que tienen como actividad principal hacer Chicha de Jora. Ya son 12 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que realiza en su trabajo. Con este préstamo de USD. 500 dólares aumentara el capital del negocio, comprará maíz.  

Asunta es una mujer luchadora y su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio. Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Asociación Arariwa por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de poder hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Asunta was born in the city of Paucartambo, Cusco Department.  She’s 49 years old.  (Paucartambo is located three hours from the city of Cusco.)  She currently lives in the city of Calca.  She’s married and has three children.  (The city of Calca is noted for its beautiful scenic spots, for being a tourist destination, for its cattle raising and for its farming.)  She is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Clorinda Matto de Turner” communal bank.

Asunta is a corn merchant.  She buys corn in various places like Calca, Urubamba and Lares.  She uses the corn to make “jora de maíz” (fermented corn) to sell to her neighbors or to fellow communal bank members whose main occupation is making “Chicha de Jora” (beverage made from fermented corn.)  She’s been in this business for 12 years now and does very well thanks to the effort she puts into it.  With this USD500 loan she will increase her working capital and buy corn.

Asunta is a tenacious woman whose dream is to make her business grow.  She is very grateful to the Asociación Arariwa Movement for helping women like her to have the opportunity to make their dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Rosalio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac; en la provincia de Cusco,  departamento del Cusco.

El socio Rosalio,  tiene 43 años de edad y El socio es conviviente; El socio  tiene 2 hijos, de 18, 11 años de edad;  El socio se dedica  a prestar el servicio de taxi, el socio es chofer de su propia unidad vehicular; en esta ocasión el socio desea invertir en el préstamo en la compra de llantas para su auto, el socio también hará el mantenimiento respectivo de su auto para que siga operativo y pueda seguir trabajando este mes, el socio con lo que gana del servicio de taxi puede invertir en casa dando la alimentación y haciéndose cargo de los gasto familiares. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de llantas para su auto y el mantenimiento de rutina.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito que le otorgarán y de este modo podrá  mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Rosalio belongs to the community bank 'Caminemos juntas' (Let's walk together). He lives in the district of Huanchac in the Cusco province, located in the department of Cusco.

Rosalio is 43 years old and lives with his partner and two children who are 18 and 11 years of age. Rosalio operates a taxi service and drives his own vehicle. He would like to buy tyres for his car and take his car in for a service so he can keep his business running this month. With the income he earns from his taxi service Rosalio provides food for his family and takes care of their living costs. 

Rosalio is infinitely grateful for the valuable loan he will be granted which will allow him to improve his quality of life. He is committed to paying his loan installments on time.

loans.use: to purchase car tyres and service his car

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria nació en la ciudad de Lares (Lares se encuentra a 2 horas de la ciudad del Cusco  del departamento del Cusco.). Ella tiene 54 años edad, vive en la ciudad de Calca, está casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos. (La ciudad de Calca caracteriza por tener hermosos paisajes por ser una zona turística, ganadera y agrícola). Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Clorinda Matto de Turner” de la Asociación Arariwa.  
  
En la reunión del banco comunal conocimos a la Señora Maria que se dedica a la venta de comestibles. Ella tiene un puesto de venta alquilado en el mercado modelo de la ciudad Calca. Ella trabaja desde las 5h30 hasta las 17h30 todos los días de la semana. Ya son 10 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que realiza en su trabajo. Ella en esta oportunidad accede al crédito para comprar mercadería así poder surtir y abastecer el puesto de venta. Con este préstamo de USD. 500 dólares aumentara el capital del negocio, comprará arroz, azucar, fideos y tarros de leche. 
 
María es una mujer luchadora y su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio. Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Asociación Arariwa por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de poder hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Maria was born in Lares, two hours from the city of Cusco in the Cusco department. She is 54, lives in Calca and is married with three children. The city of Calca is known for its beautiful landscapes and its tourism, cattle and agriculture. 

We met Maria at one of her community bank meetings. She belongs to the bank 'Clorinda Matto de Turner' which is part of the Arariwa Association. Maria sells food from a rented stall in the Calca market. She works there from 5:30am to 5:30pm, seven days a week. She has been working in this field for ten years and due to the effort she puts into her work, it has been going very well for her. 

Maria has applied for a loan to purchase groceries to stock up her stall. She will use this loan of US$500 to increase her working capital and buy rice, sugar, pasta and tinned milk. 

Maria is a determined woman whose dream is to expand her business. She is very grateful to the Arariwa Association for providing women like herself with the opportunities to make their dreams reality.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, pasta and tinned milk

loans.name: Jeannethe

texts.es: Jeannethe tiene 45 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de garaje. Tiene más de 20 años en este negocio, es una persona muy luchadora y disfruta de su actividad. Es una persona muy dinámica, ya que tiene estar pendiente de los automóviles que llegan a solicitar este servicio. El motivo del crédito es para realizarle mejoras a las casetas en donde se encuentran los automóviles  y además poder brindar más espacio. Sueña con mejorar cada día el servicio que ofrece es una persona muy responsable y necesita realizar estas mejoras para obtener ganancias.
texts.en:
Jeannethe, 45, provides garaging services.   She’s been in this business more than 20 years.  She is a very hard working person who enjoys her work.  She is very dynamic because she has to be watchful of the cars that arrive to request this service.

The reason behind the loan request is to make some improvements to the booths the cars are located in to be able to offer more space.  She dreams with improving service every day.  She is a very responsible persona and she needs to make these improvements to obtain profits.

loans.use: to do some improvements on the parking booths.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is 21 years old and single. He works in air conditioner maintenance and has been doing so for four years. In 2009 he opened his own shop. Mohamad has a good reputation as his experience helps in making his customers rely on him anytime they face a slight problem with their air conditioners
.
Mohamad is requesting his first loan from Al Majmoua in order to be prepared for the summer high season since most of his clients ask for a check-up before the hot season begins. He will use the loan to buy necessary hardware and spare parts that he might need.  Mohamad hopes to use the income he will earn this summer to cover his house ceiling which he recently started building.

loans.use: To purchase hardware necessary for his business

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a married man with six children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past 2 years, Jackson has been operating a firewood selling business.  He sells door-to-door and from home to his neighbours and passersby. In addition, he also sells charcoal to contribute to his income.  Jackson faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation in his business. He dreams of establishing a wholesale firewood business in the future.

With this loan for Kshs 20,000, Jackson wants to purchase bundles of firewood and charcoal to resell. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to his business.

loans.use: To buy firewood and charcoal

loans.name: Estela Piedad

texts.es: La señora Estela, oriunda de la Colonia  San Carlos a unos 15 kilómetros de la  localidad de San José, su actividad es la venta de sucumbe bebida tradicional de la localidad, ella vende  en la feria de alasitas, convive con el sr. Jorge el cual es albañil tienen 1 hijo pequeño, con el dinero del crédito la Sra. estela comprara un refrigerador para poder conservar sus productos e insumos para la elaboración de sus sucumbes, es una persona responsable, la señora esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo económico que le brinda para tener una mejor calidad de vida y seguir adelante superándose.
texts.en:
Señora Estela is a native of the Colonia San Carlos neighborhood about 15 kilometers from San Jose. She works, including at the Alasitas Festival, selling sucumbe, the traditional beverage of the area.  She lives with Señor Jorge who is a bricklayer. They have one young son. 

With the money from this loan Estela will buy a refrigerator to conserve her products and the supplies she uses to make the sucumbes. She is a responsible person and is grateful to the institution for the economic assistance it has provided to help her have a better quality of life and to continue working to improve her situation.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac; en la provincia de Cusco,  departamento del Cusco.

El socio Alberto,  tiene 29 años de edad y El socio es conviviente; El socio  tiene 1 hijo, de 3 años de edad;  El socio se dedica  a la artesanía, el socio tiene un stand de exhibición de artesanía y el parte de su mercadería compra hecho y parte de esto el mismo elaborara, el socio  en su stand vende ceniceros de arcilla, con figuras andinas, llaveros de carácter andino, chalinas de alpaca bebe y de oveja, gorros llamados chullos de lana, bisutería, vasijas, vasos de cerámica, pequeños monumentos en miniatura de los diferentes centros arqueológicos de Cusco; el socio desea invertir en crédito en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de diferentes trabajos para la venta. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales como arcilla, óxidos naturales para los dibujos.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito que le otorgarán y de este modo podrá  mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The loan recipient belongs to the village bank "Caminemos juntas". He lives in the district of Huanchac, Cusco province, in the department of Cusco. 

Alberto, 29, lives with his partner with whom he has a three-year-old son. He is an artist. He has an art exhibition stand, and he buys part of his merchandise already-made and the rest he makes himself. He sells clay ashtrays, Andean figurines, key chains with Andean characters, scarves made of wool and baby alpaca, wool hats called chullos, jewelry, jars, ceramic vases, and miniature replicas of the different archeological sites in Cusco. He wants to invest the loan in the purchase of materials to make his different objects for sale, like clay and natural oxides for the drawings.

He values and is grateful for the loan that he was awarded and through this he will be able to improve his quality of life. He promises to make the loan payments during the stipulated time frame.

loans.use: to purchase materials like clay and natural oxides for his drawings.

loans.name: Nayruth Noeli

texts.es:
Nayruth nació en el distrito de Calca provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco y tiene 21 años edad.  (Calca se encuentra a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco). Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad de donde nació y pertenece al banco comunal “Clorinda Matto de Turner” de la Asociación Arariwa. (La ciudad de Calca caracteriza por tener hermosos paisajes por ser una zona turística, ganadera y agrícola). 

Nayruth se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas, ella viaja una vez a la semana a la zona de la selva específicamente de la ciudad de Yanatile y compra fruta. Ella de retorno a la ciudad de Calca distribuye o vende a diferentes vendedoras de los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Calca. En esta oportunida requiere el prestamo para aumentar el capital del negocio. Con este préstamo de USD. 500 dólares surtirá su negocio con más productos, comprará por ejemplo plátanos, papayas y otras frutas de acuerdo a la temporada. 

Nayruth es una mujer luchadora y su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio. Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Asociación Arariwa por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de poder hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Nayruth, 21, was born in the district of Calca, which lies in the province of Calca in the department of Cusco. (Calca is 45 minutes fro the city of Cusco). Currently she lives in the city where she was born and is part of the village bank "Clorinda Matto de Turner" in the Arariwa Association. Calca is known for having beautiful countrysides and is a zone of tourism, cattle and agriculture.

Nayruth buys and sells fruits. Once a week she travels to the jungle, specifically to the city of Yanatile, and buys fruit. She returns to Calca to distribute or sell to different vendors in the markets of the city. On this occasion she needs a loan to increase her business capital. With this loan of US$500 she will stock her store with more products. For example, she will buy plantains, papayas and other fruits that are in season.

Nayruth is a go-getter and her dream is to make her business grow. She is very thankful to the Arariwa Association Movement for helping women like her to have the opportunity to be able to realize their dreams.

loans.use: to buy plantains, papaya and other seasonal fruits.

loans.name: Jardines De Paz Group

texts.es:
El grupo Jardines de Paz lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Milagro de Socorro de 71 años quien en 1996 inicio su negocio de comercio de calzado y ropa con 1,500 córdobas. Ella tiene 7 ciclos de trabajar con Adim en los cuales su negocio ha ido creciendo e invertirá el crédito en el fortalecimiento de este con la compra de calzado y ropa variada.
Las otras integrantes son Felipa de 41 años quien vende tortillas, rellenitas, café, fresco y platanito desde hace 7 años y Marisol quien tiene un modesto taller de costura desde hace 10 años.
texts.en:
The group Jardines de Paz [Gardens of Peace] consists of three hard working and enterprising women. One of them is Milagro de Socorro who is 71 years old. In 1966 she began her footwear and clothing business with 1,500 Cordobas. She has completed seven loan cycles with ADIM, expanding her business. She will invest this credit to further strengthen her business with the purchase of footwear and various articles of clothing.

The other members are Felipa who is 41 years old and has been selling tortillas, black pudding, coffee, drinks, and banana chips for 7 years and Marisol who has run a modest sewing workshop for 10 years.

loans.use: purchase footwear and clothing merchandise.

loans.name: Carmen Luz

texts.es:
Carmen nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y tiene 40 años edad.  (Paucartambo se encuentra a 2 horas de la ciudad del Cusco). Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad de Calca, está casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos. (La ciudad de Calca caracteriza por tener hermosos paisajes por ser una zona turística, ganadera y agrícola). Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Clorinda Matto de Turner” de la Asociación Arariwa.    

En la reunión del banco comunal conocimos a la Señora Carmen que se dedica a la venta de comestibles y tiene un puesto de venta alquilado en el mercado modelo de la ciudad Calca. Ella paga una alquiler de aproximadamente de 80 nuevos soles para trabajar desde las 5h30 hasta las 18h00 todos los días de la semana. Ya son 7 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que realiza en su trabajo. Ella en esta oportunidad accede al crédito para comprar mercadería así poder surtir y abastecer el puesto de venta. Con este préstamo de USD. 500 dólares aumentara el capital del negocio, comprará sacos de arroz y azucar.
 
Carmen es una mujer luchadora y su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio. Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Asociación Arariwa por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de poder hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Carmen was born in the city of Paucartambo and she is 40 years old. Paucartambo is 2 hours from the city of Cuzco. At present, she lives in the city of Calca. She is married and has two children. The city of Calca is characterized by having beautiful landscapes and for being a tourist attraction with cattle and farming. She belongs to the “Clorinda Matto de Turner” community bank of the Asociación Arariwa.    

We met Carmen at the community bank meeting. She sells food and has a rented locale in the market of the city of Calca. She pays approximately 80 nuevos soles in rent to work from 5:30 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. every day of the week. She has been doing this business for 7 years and it is going very well for her thanks to her hard work.  She is taking out the loan at this time to buy merchandise to be able to supply her sales location. With this loan of USD. 500, she will increase her working capital, buying sacks of rice and sugar.  
 
Carmen is a fighting woman and her dream is to grow her business. She is very grateful to the Movimiento Asociación Arariwa for helping women such as her to have opportunuties to be able to make their dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Ambenakola Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Ambenakola, sont toutes des femmes mariées ont en moyenne 37 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Massoukou, sous préfecture de Fana; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de charbon de bois  et de sel de cuisine.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Ambenakola sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter  du  charbon et du sel.                                                                          
La cliente BAGNEBA compte acheter 30 sacs de charbon de bois avec les charbonniers du village et environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement au village de Massoukou, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce de charbon.
texts.en:
The women belonging to the Ambenakola group are all married with an average age of 37 years old and three children; they all live in traditional extended families in the village of Massoukou in the sub-prefecture of Fana, which lies in the Koulikoro region (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region). 
They met each other through relatives, neighbors and friends. They sell charcoal and kitchen salt. 

The women of the Ambenakola group are on their second group loan, which will be used to buy charcoal and salt. 

The customer, Bagnegba, is planning to buy 30 sacks of charcoal from coal producers in the village and surrounding areas. She carries out her sales every day in the village of Massoukou, for cash and on credit, to a customer base made up of men and women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 15,000FCFA, which will be used to make her loan repayments and contribute to social ceremonies; the balance will be reinvested in her coal trading activity.

.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy onions, tomatoes, carrots and bananas

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina nació en la ciudad de Calca y tiene 29 años edad.  (Calca se encuentra a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco). Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad donde nació y es madre y padre par sus dos hijos. (La ciudad de Calca caracteriza por tener hermosos paisajes por ser una zona turística, ganadera y agrícola). Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Clorinda Matto de Turner” de la Asociación Arariwa. 
   
En la reunión del banco comunal conocimos a la Señora Karina que nos cuenta que tiene una pequeña tienda de librería y piñatería. Ella cada mes paga un alquiler del local y local está ubicado cerca a la plaza de armas de la ciudad e Calca. Ya son 5 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que realiza en su trabajo. Ella en esta oportunidad accede al crédito para comprar mercadería así poder surtir y abastecer su tienda. Con este préstamo de USD. 700 dólares aumentara el capital del negocio, comprará cuadernos, gorros infantiles y otras cosas más. 

Karina es una mujer luchadora y su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio. Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Asociación Arariwa por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de poder hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Karina was born in the city of Calca and is 29 years old. Calca is 45 minutes from the city of Cuzco. At present, she lives in the city where she was born and she is both mother and father to her two children. The city of Calca is characterized by its beautifullandscapes and for being a tourist attraction, with cattle and farming. She belongs to the “Clorinda Matto de Turner” community bank of the Asociación Arariwa. 
   
We met Karina at the meeting of the community bank. She tells us she has a small book and pinata store. She pays rent every month for a locale and the locale is close to the Plaza de Armas of the city of Calca. She has had this business for 5 years and it is going very well for her thanks to her hard work. At this time she is taking out the loan to buy merchandise and thus supply her store. With this loan of USD. 700, she will increase her working capital. She will buy notebooks, children's hats and more.  

Karina is a fighting woman and her dream is to grow her business. She is very grateful to the Movimiento Asociación Arariwa for helping women such as her to have opportunties to make their dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, children's hats, and more.

loans.name: Charo

texts.es:
Charo nació en el distrito de Coya y tiene 33 años edad. (Coya se encuentra a 10 minutos de la ciudad del Calca).
